Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: starmanistanbul
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We went there as a part of our honeymoon and the hotel must have known as they provided complimentary chocolate strawberries and champagne. The log fire is an excellent touch to give the room a homely feel. With nothing being higher then one floor, it made getting around easy and close to the car park. Also it is a great location just to walk around some of the wineries around Yountville. Breakfasts were great. My only complaint was that I found the concierge lady a bit snotty to us (maybe because we are British as she was fine with local american guests)

Reviews.Title: “Dated rooms, horrible internet taint entire experience.”
Reviews.Author: antitourists
Reviews.Content: The location of The Villagio is perfect for visiting the tasting rooms and restaurants of Yountville. They provide a large breakfast and afternoon tasting with cheese and snacks which is fine if you can stand the piano player who literally plays to the Boomers (muzac versions of The Eagles, for example). The pool and hot tub area are lovely, as are the grounds. But. The wifi literally could not withstand all the users, so during the day it was unusably slow and just cut off regularly. Our room (117) was huge. That is the last good thing about it. The carpet gave me horrible allergies, the water pressure was so weak I could barely wash my hair. The room has zero privacy if you have the blinds open because people walk by constantly, so if you go please request an upper level room. I could also hear every footstep of the people over you. The Villagio needs a radical room update. I think I am the wrong demographic...If you don't care about the internet, huge accessible rooms matter more to you than clean and bright and you don't ever wash your hair, this is the place for you. The other complaint was about the breakfast. Which was ok, but certainly not fantastic. The "champagne" was poured by one man who also had to make all the espresso bar drinks. The waiting time was long and I also felt sorry for this lone man with far too much work. So I skipped the bubbly and drank their drip coffee which was not good at all. If you go to Yountville and you can stay here for $150, considering the location and food and wine options, go. But if you pay over $300 and expect a higher level of finishings and services, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property”
Reviews.Author: BellaTurista
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in late April. The trip was to celebrate my birthday. Immediately, I was impressed by the attention to detail in the public areas, and later, our room. The lobby was very comfortable and beautifully decorated. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon. They were having afternoon tea and a wine tasting. Tea was accompanied by various tea sandwiches, pastries, devilled eggs, scones and toppings -- all delicious. A porter met us at our vehicle and brought our bags up to our room. The room was very welcoming and nicely sized. There was a complimentary bottle of champagne chilling, in addition to the complimentary bottle of wine, in honor of my birthday. Although it was a bit warm for us to use the fireplace, there was a log and matches, just in case. There was both a Nespresso maker and a coffee maker. The bed was very comfortable, the bed linens were soft, and the robes were like clouds -- the towels not quite so much; they could have been a bit fluffier. We had a nicely-sized balcony with a view of the lovely grounds. The grounds were perfectly manicured. There were flowering trees, shrubs and plants everywhere, and the long course of fountains was wonderful. The pool area was very nice too, complete with cabanas and a hot tub, although it was a trifle cool, and we were too busy to use them. We also had a spa reservation that, due to unforeseen circumstances, we had to cancel, but the spa services sounded really nice. Each morning there was an included buffet breakfast, complete with champagne, mimosas, bloody marys or greyhounds. There was an omelet bar, breakfast potatoes, pastries, fruit, muffins, irish oatmeal (yummy) and hot banana bread pudding daily. The breakfast entree rotated (biscuits & gravy, chilaquiles, quiche, etc.), and on the weekend there was also a waffle bar. You could eat inside or under the umbrellas on the patio. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was very convenient to access the rest of the valley. Also, it was across the street from Bouchon Bistro (very good) and Bistro Jeanty. The best part was that it was connected to Michael Chiarello's Bottega (wonderful). I loved my stay here and just wish we'd had even longer.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: jazzfan647
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Napa Valley and stayed at Villagio with a group from a woman's club. The hotel staff went beyond all expectations and made our stay wonderful. Our price included a breakfast buffet everyday--including bloody marys and mimosas! And they had a lovely afternoon tea for a nice pick-me-up. I was able to take some time and relax in the spa. I had a wonderful "Tranquility" treatment with Carol. It included a scrub, followed by a wrap in milk bath, and then a full body massage. HEAVEN! I've stayed in Napa Valley a few other times and when I return we'll be staying at Villagio.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mmbett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a one night getaway in April. The grounds are beautiful! The room was very large and nicely furnished with a patio area and huge bathroom. The free bottle of wine in the room was a nice surprise, too. The grounds were meticulously maintained and offered an "away from it all" feeling - even though we were close to shops and restaurants. The breakfast in the morning was wonderful, with an omelet station and lots of other fresh, hearty choices - definitely NOT your run of the mill breakfast offerings! It would have been nice to have more time to enjoy this inn - the spa and pool looked wonderful, too!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice getaway for wine tasting”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr11_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Villagio in Yountville. We had a king room and it was quite large. The bed was incredibly soft and our room came with two very soft and cozy robes to use while we were there. We loved them. Our room had a great balcony with chairs to sit in while we looked over the courtyard that had a pond and waterfall. Very nice espresso machine and coffee in the room and also a refrigerator. There was a complimentary bottle of wine waiting for us when we got there. We enjoyed the duraflame log in the fireplace and the shutters were a nice touch for blocking out the early morning sunshine. They have English tea at 4:00 which we missed but the breakfast in the morning was outstanding. High-end pastries, but also oatmeal, breakfast burritos, fresh fruit, potatoes, and a full omelet bar with quality ingredients like spinach and asparagus in addition to the peppers, meats and cheese most of them have. At $315 a night this is a pretty spendy place to stay but it is convenient to the wineries in the area and a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley gem”
Reviews.Author: b_lang3
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the Napa Valley area, this is an excellent hotel and spa. The rooms are as you would expect for a upscale resort and the grounds are beautiful. The associated restaurant is very good and it's in walking distance to other restaurants. The location in Yountville is central to the north and south wineries in the Valley, and also to the northern part of Sanoma.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Wine and Food Lovers”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaCV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 4 night stay after reading about the Villagio in Travel + Leisure. We recently had our second child and wanted a get-away for just the two of us to "unplug". We were not disappointed! The location is perfect - walking distance to all the amazing restaurants Yountville has to offer and just a short drive to too many vineyards to count. The champagne breakfast is remarkable and very substantial! Made to order omlettes were a treat. We worked with Mary the concierge ahead of time to book a driver to take us to a variety of vineyards. She was thorough and attentive and our driver Edgar was wonderful. Alan the bartender is a wealth of knowledge and extremely attentive. The rooms are the perfect size with large bathrooms, comfortable beds, lots of windows and a fireplace. The spa is relaxing and clean and our treatments were heavenly. The afternoon high-tea and wine tastings were a nice treat, though admittedly we usually had enjoyed too much wine by that time to partake!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stay”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentTraveler58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this two weeks before our trip. We booked on Expedia and I think we got a great rate (<$200/night). Probably helped that we were in the off-season. This is peaceful place to stay...everything was sort of idyllic. The grounds, the fountains, the European feel. We missed the afternoon tea/snacks but the hot chocolate on arrival was awesome and the breakfast (included in the rate) was unique and really good. Room was really nice. Yountville is a tiny peaceful town, in between Napa and St Helena. You could miss it if you weren't looking for a hotel or one of the big-name restaurants in town, but it was nice for walking around. Great launching point for winery touring. A previous posting mentioned trouble with 'stomping' heard from their 1st floor room. We were on the 1st floor and didn't notice a thing. Maybe there was no one up there. Don't think we would have paid full price...not that it wouldn't be worth it in peak season but we just don't spend that on hotels very often. If you can get a great deal though, grab it. Side note...we're not French Laundry sort of people for dinner...we picked Hurleys in Yountville for dinner and it was a great meal and definitely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Affordably Priced, Extra Perks”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel on a very last minute basis for just 1 night - last night. We arrived mid-afternoon starving, so the mini hot chocolates presented to you upon check-in was much appreciated, and as luck would have it, we arrived during their high tea time, and got to feast on tasty hors d' ouevres immediately upon arrival. Thank goodness! After eating a light snack (we had reservations at Bouchon in the early evening), we headed to our room and found it to be cute and cozy with a real wood-burning fireplace and a complimentary bottle of wine, both of which we enjoyed later in the evening. Villagio also offers a complimentary buffet breakfast which we also enjoyed the following morning - delicious food, omelets, and mimosas! We left stuffed. We missed their free evening wine tasting since we were out, but all the added perks of this hotel: free tea & snacks, free evening wine tasting, free bottle of wine in the room, and free buffet breakfast, made this hotel hard to beat for the price and why we chose it over several others. Can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Villaaaaaahhhgio!”
Reviews.Author: Rsjones7
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid March for a business/pleasure trip. Susan, events coordinator, handled every detail for our group. She was by our side non-stop to ensure all details went smoothly. From the moment you walk in, you feel your stress level drop and your relaxation mode kick in! We were handed a glass of wine and a warm welcoming smile despite the rainy day! Rooms are very spacious and comfortable. Logs provided each night for fire place and given the weather, that was perfect! Grounds are landscaped beautifully and well kept. Water feature and flowers run down the middle of the grounds. Pool and cabanas very nice looking although we did not lounge due to weather. Spa is exceptional, yet quietly understated which is refreshing. A very pleasant atmosphere to relax and enjoy the top notch amenities. Therapists all friendly and polite and very well trained in their craft. (Kate and Julia, thumbs up!) Breakfast buffet is more than your average fare. Figs, cheeses, pastries, fresh fruit, potatoes, casseroles, and cooked to order omelette station. Complimentary Bloody Mary or Villagio Greyhound offered. Villagio is situated in the heart of Yountville, a quaint and lovely town to explore the many shops and restaurants. Ideally located to venture out to wine tastings. Whether you are traveling as a couple or with a group on business, but mostly pleasure I hope, I highly recommend the Villagio!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Yountville!”
Reviews.Author: Isabella091108
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Villagio this past week for 4 days as we toured around the wineries. It was a great stay and I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to the Napa area. This was our first time to the area and I was unsure as to where to stay. Yountville is great because you’re close to many amazing restaurants including my favorite Bottega. You have to drive to the wineries regardless of where you stay and Villagio in Yountville is centrally located to many great ones to choose from. The hotel itself was amazing. The breakfast was better than any other hotel morning breakfast I have ever had. A lot to select from and different options every day to pick from. The Mimosas and Bloody Mary’s are a definitely plus. The rooms were big and clean. I am very picky where I stay and Villagio went above and beyond my expectations. We used the spa facilities the last day and we were sad we didn’t use it earlier. It’s free in your stay and very nice complementary steam rooms and sauna to relax in. We traveled up North for a few days and stayed in a different hotel in Calistoga and were very sad to leave Villagio, it was much better than our second place we stayed in. Villagio was worth every penny and hope to make it back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: yvettemz
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Villagio Inn in Yountville, CA for an amazing 4 days in Napa event. It is already on the calendar for next year. The spa was great. The room was a nice size with a fireplace. Ready to order omelets every morning was a great way to start the day. The service and the staff were really friendly and helpful. This location also sits in the middle of culinary heaven. Bouchon, French Laundry and Hurley's just to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zeebs3
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Villagio Inn and we were pleasantly surprised. I'll admit this was not our first choice (Bardessono has become too expensive, Yountville Inn was booked) but after our stay at the Villagio Inn we'll be adding this Hotel to the short list and will most likely return for future trips. We arrived mid morning and our room was already cleaned and we were able to check in early, off to a great start. Our room included a bottle of wine and hands-down thee best free breakfast at a Hotel I've ever enjoyed. What would cost upwards of $35+ at other locations was quite a treat and an excellent way to start each day (Omelet bar, fresh fruit, cheese, breads/bagels, mimosa/bloody marys) was complimentary!!! Our room was very large, had a nice porch, huge bathroom, massive king bed and a fireplace. Housekeeping did an excellent job tending the room and provided extra duraflame logs upon request. The location of this Hotel really cannot be beat - you're in the middle of Yountville, across from Redd/Ad Hoc and a stones throw from Bouchon and other great eateries. We did not enjoy the pool or spa services - perhaps next time. Only issue with this hotel is the walls are rather thin and were awaken 1 night during our stay from some loud mattress Olympics above us and another night from loud talkers next door. Overall - this place is cheaper in cost than other Yountville Hotels but definitely worth considering as it's a great value!

Reviews.Title: “The best massage ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jordanlondon83
Reviews.Content: I visited the spa at Villagio, I didn't stay at the hotel but the spa was great, the services are great, very clean and tidy and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The outdoor hot tub is really nice and the surroundings very relaxing. Then I had the best massage ever, i have been to top spas across the world and this was one of the best. Ashleigh gave me an amazing massage, highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really great, Try Villagio in Yountville.”
Reviews.Author: JustPeg
Reviews.Content: Have read about this place over the years, and have noted the occasional person who was disappointed. Finally, my friend and I decided to try it, and Yountville. We do a girls get-away for 3-4 days each year, and have stayed in a variety of nice places. We were very pleased with Villagio. Strong Pluses: The FOOD ( buffet breakfast, and afternoon Tea, they make their own food and it was all luscious), the SPA ( we each had a fabulous and memorable treatment, and loved the facilities(though very complicated multi-head showers)), the Staff: all friendly and helpful. Our room was also very nice, and we had a decent rate ( for yountville) of 209$ per night. The room was spacious and all the little details were great. It was a 'yes" kind of place. The flowers around the grounds were incredible. The minus that you will read about: Yountville as a destination is essentially one road (washington street) running parallel to HWY 29, which runs up the Napa valley. The back side of Villagio, and its sister hotel, the Vintage Inn, sits next to the HWY. We were in the middle of the buildings towards the HWY. We heard the highway anytime we were going in and out of our room/ building area. We were not bothered at all by the HWY once we were in our room. Now, I will note that it was raining while we were there, so our windows were closed, and we did not use our little balcony, which would not be true during the normally very nice weather in the Napa valley. But our trip was great and we were very happy and not bothered by HWY 29 at all. We ate at BOTTEGA, one of several "famous Chef" restaurants. It was incredible and we would strongly recommend it. Creative and fresh Italian. We hired a driver for wine tasting from a place called: Destination Drivers: they sent a driver to the hotel, and she drove us anywhere we wanted in our own car. It is the cheapest way to get around wine tasting (we have tried all the companies in the Napa valley). It is especially great, since we get tips on small and interesting wineries to visit, some private, so you have to schedule appointments.... this driving company will take you where you want to go. Most tours pick the wineries for you. Try Cliff Lede, which is down the Yountville crossroad. Look at his map of his vineyards: they are each named after an old rock song. Try the tasting room right in Yountville for Jessup.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: FEBTRIP46
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying here! The service, the breakfast, high tea, and the staff were all fabulous. The hotel is perfectly located in Yountville with numerous restaurants and shopping all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy”
Reviews.Author: CopanoJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in early March. The staff at the hotel was very helpful (including assistance with making and changing reservations). The welcome cocktail was also a nice touch. The oversized rooms are well maintained, and the seperate sitting area is nice if you have to work. Overall, a good experience and a hotel that I would choose again.

Reviews.Title: “*Sigh*”
Reviews.Author: SunMoonSea
Reviews.Content: The Villagio Inn and Spa is a lovely, luxurious, in all ways delightful experience that I highly recommend. The property itself is like an unexpected oasis, so close to world-class restaurants (and Highway 29!) that one might think noise would be a factor. Not so. The plush and spacious suites are a peaceful haven--I don't think I've ever slept better in my life! And the many amenities (including a delicious breakfast) at the inn, and within the spa, offer something relaxing and wonderful for everyone. You will be pampered and attended to like royalty during your stay; the best kind of spoiling in my book! Last but not least, the place smells divine. Those of you who pay attention to the way a place smells (fresh and clean you cannot fake) will know exactly what I mean!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Girls weekend!”
Reviews.Author: gomannlife
Reviews.Content: Villagio was the best spot to celebrate my 40th with 20 of my favorite women! We planned this far in advance with the help of Soo Bonzano who is such a doll! She was so accomodating and enjoyable to work with! All of the staff was over the top helpful and available despite the busy weekend and full house they had. The spa was incredible! I had the best treatment for 100 minutes! So worth the $! Gloria, the group spa reservations gal, was extremely helpful and a wealth of information. I was so blessed to have Marcy work on me! She was AMAZING! The Spa attendant, Debbie, was the friendliest and sweetest person! We all loved her warmth and enthusiasm. Thank you to all of the staff especially the ones mentioned above! We had the best time! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay at the Villagio”
Reviews.Author: jkuryak
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions and would recommend the hotel to our friends. Staff is very courteous and helpful. They start off your day with a great breakfast. Make sure you ask for a latte or Bloody Mary. The hotel has been open for a while and the only negative I have is some rooms need some minor maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Felt pampered!”
Reviews.Author: pvickwoo
Reviews.Content: First trip to Napa and loved this place! Will definitely go back. Greeted @ check-in with a cup of rich hot chocolate! Room is large, full of light, and filled with amenities as mentioned in the other reviews. When we returned from dinner, our beds were turned down, shutters closed, and 2 bottles of water sitting next to the beds. There is a fridge in the room although we didn't need to use it. The all inclusive breakfast buffet had everything one could need, made-to-order omelets, fruit, pastries, cereals, and mimosas or bloody marys. We called Bottega prior to arrival for reservations but they said they didn't have any available seatings, but the Concierge was able to get us a reservation. It was a short walk from the hotel so no need to drive to dinner. The only suggestion I would make if you're a light sleeper is to see if you can get a room away from the freeway. Didn't hear any traffic during the night, but did early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Your new home in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: Traveldennis
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th trip to Napa in the last 13 months. Before we stayed down in Napa and enjoyed it. But there is so much to be said for staying in Yountville, parking your car and walking to Michelin starred restaurants for dinner. There is no place better than Villagio to call home for this experience. A four star property but a 5 star experience. From the front desk check-in to the wonderful all-inclusive breakfast can only be described as truly delightful. The generous pour of champagne to the extensive buffet breakfast is an addition that quickly justifies the room rates. Your very comfortable room will likely have a fire place and in our case a balcony that overlooked the heated pool. The pool are comes with not only comfortable seating but twin lounge furnishings with canopy that can make an afternoon a memorable day. Take my word for it, they know what they are doing at the Villagio.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: Welcomed with champagne, we had a smooth check-in. The service was excellent. Our room was on the second floor and very spacious. Loved the fireplace! The room was well-appointed with great bath products, Nespresso and regular coffee makers, welcome bottle of wine with great wine glasses, and robes. Large tub-shower, double sinks, Spotlessly clean- nothing was overlooked. Turn down service with bottled water and fresh ice. The champagne brunch was amazing, especially on New Years Day. We also enjoyed afternoon tea in the lobby with all the trimmings, and then wine tasting and munchies at 5:30! We had a discounted rate, so all the extras were quite unexpected and enjoyable. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Loved walking around the property with the sound of splashing fountains- very Italian! Our only suggestions for improvement would be to open the gym earlier than 7:30AM and get fluffier towels!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie D
Reviews.Content: What an amazing spot - service was exceptional, rooms were beautiful and cozy, and the view was spectacular. Great selection of teas/coffees. In room fir place was a nice little perk, and they gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. Complimentary breakfast was in a class of its own!!!! Bloody mary, omelette bar, pastries, and pretty much all the breakfast food you could think of. We really enjoyed this hotel. Yountville offers a great variety of quaint spots for dinner, and it's close to all the great wineries of Napa county. Stay here for a great trip to the wine country!

Reviews.Title: “Villagio in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: Susan S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous, the staff and services couldn't be any better. They served a delicious full breakfast every day and wine tasting on Fri and Sat nights. The layout of the corner room was spacious. They could improve their movie selections on the TV. My main complaint is that the rooms were dark and to open the window coverings exposed you to people walking by who could see in the room. The view from the room was of another room. Perhaps a second floor room would help to solve this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little extras, not as luxurious as the price tag would suggest”
Reviews.Author: MarbellaCapital
Reviews.Content: The hotel goes out of its way to make guests feel welcome. Welcome bottle of wine, working fire place, wine tasting and snacks in the evening, wonderful breakfast spread (inclusive)... The grounds are well manicured and tasteful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. One does not get the feeling that his would be a cheap motel in any town other than Yountville (as another reviewer has suggested), but the layout of the place does make it feel like this place was not built for the purpose of a luxury resort, but rather was converted from an apartment complex or something similar... All in all, not too bad. Proximity to all the nice restaurants in Yountville is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Villagio--Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Italy1982
Reviews.Content: The Villagio is the at the height of perfection. The property is beautiful and the rooms are immaculate. It was hard to leave such a beautiful room and every night the bed was turned down and a fresh bottle of evian was near the bed. They also provide you with a welcome bottle of wine. Each morning, breakfast is provided and they offer afternoon tea and snacks. This is one of my favorite places and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Everything There”
Reviews.Author: Teresa32490
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villagio Inn & Spa for a long weekend. The room size was very large and comfortable. The Bathrooms had two sinks and closet and storage space was plentiful. Our room had a working fireplace with a Duraflame firelog replaced everyday (when we needed matches to light the fire, I called the front desk sent someone up, in 10 minutes in the rain!)The location was very centrally located, that we walked every night to a different resturant. The complementry daily breakfast buffet was more like a "spread" that you would see at a high end hotel cost over $35.00. We will definatly stay at Villagio in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “In any other town, would be considered a nice motor lodge.”
Reviews.Author: SuperCarnitas
Reviews.Content: (Off-season weekday visit, booked via Jetsetter, in the low-$200s range per night. "Inside Courtyard" room type to avoid the freeway noise.) In a lot of ways this place captures today's Napa Valley: Down-to-earth agricultural honky-tonk, recently repackaged as an international lifestyle destination. As such, sometimes the rough core shows through the outer facade. For the Villagio Inn that means you have what would've been a motor lodge if it wasn't located in "NapaStyle" Yountville: - Parking lot that surrounds a 2-story building, with some of the rooms directly facing that parking lot - Decidedly Residence-Inn-by-Marriott building quality - Exterior corridors that grants views into guestrooms - Impossibly loud heater (it's the old-fashioned kind where the rattly radiator/fan unit is placed under the window facing said exterior corridors) - Even when booked in the interior-facing rooms, a din from a divided freeway section of Highway 29, with the spikes from tractor-trailers roaring past in the night Now, they've done A LOT of work with the soft product to make the place spiffy: + The room fixtures, furniture, and bedding items were top-class + In-room fireplace is a very nice touch + Room amenities like the comp bottle of wine, Equator coffee, nice coffee makers were delightful + Included wine tasting happy hours and breakfasts make for a very "complete" experience + And the people working there were universally friendly and professional ... but all in all, it was hard to escape the motor lodge feel. In the end you have to look past the little freebies, and just embrace the idea that you're paying a big premium for the Yountville location. I'd recommend staying here only if: * You can get a discounted rate -- I'd be even more disappointed if I had paid the high-season rack rate, with the requisite minimum stay requirements * You absolutely need to stay in Yountville for the ability to stagger home after a big dining event -- Redd and Ad Hoc are right across the street, with everything else in Yountville within a 2-block walk My lodging picks for the Napa side of the Wine Country remain Carneros Inn and Solage Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: surfindoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Villagio and had stayed at Bardessono one year prior. Comparing the two, bardessono was hands down our favorite. Villagio has a more Italian villa feel vs Bardessono which is contemporary, modern, zen. The property at Villagio is very nice and the rooms are very large. A mishap happened where we were supposed to receive a gift in our room from my brother in law and sister in law for my husband's birthday. Turns out the gift never arrived and went to another guest. When we discovered this one hour before we were about to leave, initially the manager seemed at a loss for what happened and how to make it up to us. He then offered us to go to the spa to pick out some complimentary products. However, the concierge guy (who was on the job investigating exactly what happened) was COMPLETELY RUDE, and basically blamed my sister in law for botching up the whole delivery. He was totally unprofessional and a jerk, honestly. In the end, after our stay, our sister in law and brother in law complained about the botch up and they ended up comp-ing our stay! If we were to return, we would stay at Bardessono again. PROS: great location (close to bouchon, bottega), nice grounds, fireplace in room, nespresso machines in room, breakfast buffet was wonderful, hot chocolate when you check in CONS: Customer service is not great, concierge guy was horrible, outside is a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yellotail
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days at the end of August for our anniversary. I've stayed at this hotel two other times, and at their sister hotel, The Vintage Inn, just down the street once. Both hotels are lovely. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. The setting is relaxed and cozy. The location cannot be beat, as this small town has more Michelin Stars than any other small town in North America. It's great to be able to WALK to a different 5 star restaurant every night. Also loved how they didn't 'nickle-and-dime' you to death. Free paper, internet, coffee/espresso in the rooms, champagne breakfast, afternoon tea.... As much as I love to try new places, in my mind, the Villagio is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: eligadd
Reviews.Content: This place was incredible from the moment we pulled up! The grounds are immaculant. The staff was courteous and always professional. The room was quite large. By no means a regular hotel room. The breakfast buffet was always plentiful, fresh and had a great variety. Unfortunately, we didnt get to enjoy the evening wine tasting. The concierge service was very helpful. Recommend calling in advance for planning assistance. I cannot say enough about this hotel. I looked at all the other hotels (outside from street), but I think this is the best -- over sister hotel, Vintage Inn too. Oh, spa is luxurious. Very convenient to all restaurants. Nice for evening strolls.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice......”
Reviews.Author: cal1178
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May. It was a little chilly but the rooms were very nice. The staff was definitely of Napa quality. The resort has a unique "Tuscany" feel. Would stay here again. Priced very right.

Reviews.Title: “Villagio may be a little pricey but you come away completely relaxed.”
Reviews.Author: MPWMemphis
Reviews.Content: Rendezvous with adult children and friends at Villagio for the holiday was so nice, relaxing and easy! The location is perfect and close to everywhere you want to be. We traveled easily to visit in SF via Marin Co. within 1.5 hours. The restaurants nearby are all excellent, even accommodating a vegetarian group. Dinner on Xmas day was great at Brix. Bottega restaurant is within walking distance. We liked the fireplace in the room, the attitude is always "yes" to any request, spa and gym on the site, & the amazing buffet breakfast is great also. My tips are to ask to stay in a room upstairs to cut down on noise, rent a bike for a few hours, & get tips from the concierge. This is our second visit in 10 years and it has improved over te years.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: topsweeper
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but it felt longer...and we wished we had stayed longer. We were able to check in at 1:00 p.m. and received a complimentary upgrade to a suite. The suite was lovely - large king-sized bed, flat screen TV,, sitting room, jacuzzi tub, wetbar, expresso machine - even wine racks. The customer service was top notch, as was the afternoon tea and the morning champagne brunch. We regret that we did not have time for the spa, but we definitely will on a return visit. What a great value for such a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful getaway”
Reviews.Author: oh_holidays08
Reviews.Content: We sadly only stayed here for one night on the weekend, wish we had more time!!! The property is really quiet and peaceful. Location is right in the small town of Yountville - walking distance to French Laundry, Bistro Jeanty and other restaurants. There's a tiny "vineyard", if you can even call it that, next to the resort - well it's more of a patch of land with grape vines. It's a nice touch and adds character to the place. We were a little wary before we got there because the pictures from Tripadvisor did not look that great. But let me tell you, you can't capture the atmosphere in a picture - it's absolutely lovely, romantic, relaxing and peaceful. The property itself is beautiful too (I don't know why this doesn't come through very well in the pictures), maybe because the rooms are a little dim. I loved it though - very cozy, romantic and comfortable. It's quite spacious and I could definitely just hangout in the room if we weren't going vineyard hopping! There was a separate dressing/bathroom area, space for a writing desk, separate coffee table/chairs in another corner... and the best part... a working FIREPLACE! A bottle of wine comes with the room - nice touch. Upon arrival, there are drinks in the lobby. In the evenings, they have wine tasting and a pianist in the lobby. And breakfast was amazing! Great comfort food fare - in addition to the usual breakfast buffet stuff, there was also chicken and waffles, biscuits and gravy, bread pudding AND champagne! If you wan't a quick weekend getaway from San Francisco, this resort is the perfect place to relax and recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Phil32999
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here on other trip advisor reviews and it was better than described! First the price for what you got was a great value in comparison to similar properties. The room was updated, clean and spacious. There was an instant expresso machine in the room which was a big plus if your a coffee fanatic like me. Room had a spacious bathroom with two sinks and a Jacuzzi tub. All of the windows had wood adjustable shutters so if you don't like to wake up to the sun this was perfect. Room had a complimetary bottle of wine on the fireplace mantle when we arrived with two wine glasses and an opener. In the morning they have an egg chef out on the patio taking your omlet or egg orders and inside there was a huge buffet style spread with too many good things to list! There was complimentary champagne for mimosa's alsthough it was Mumm so you could drink it without. There was also a Bloody Mary bar inside as well. All this for just over 200.00 a night? Wow...highly recommend! p.s. Right in the heart of the very quaint downtown Yountville shopping and restaurant district...walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for wine country exploration”
Reviews.Author: bigkisses
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights are part of our honeymoon in September. Pre-arrival we had lots of contact with the hotel and they were always friendly and very helpful. The concierge was brilliant at advising us on trips and even secured us a table at The French Laundry. Check in was very smooth, even through we arrived early and we had a great room with views over the pool. Breakfast was a buffet in the lobby lounge with egg and pancake stations outside. The staff even helped us organise a mid-night snack of Dominos pizza! A great location for exploring the wine country and centrally located to so many restaurants. A lovely hotel with very friendly staff. We wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Primus09
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at the Villagio in December 2011 was an all-around disappointment. The biggest problem was the traffic noise. We were located on the parking lot side of the property and heard constant traffic noise from Highway 29. It was the noisiest room I have ever stayed in, even when compared to inexpensive rooms along interstate highways or next to airports. The rooms on the other side of the fountains seem like they would be much quieter and were priced the same. The rooms were nothing special but were larger than most. Other services were also lacking. The website stated: For those who fancy blending wine with technology, Villagio offers complimentary use of iTouch units pre-programmed with local winery maps and tasting routes but the two front desk staff had no idea what I was talking about when I requested one. I don't know if this is a training issue or the website is just wrong. Breakfast food was fine (omelets were great) but the area was very congested and it was always difficult to get a table making it an unpleasant way to start the day. Yountville is my favorite place to stay in Napa Valley. The Hotel Yountville is far superior but did not have rooms available when I booked my vacation. Next time I will make sure Hotel Yountville has availability before finalizing my travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet home away from home”
Reviews.Author: BoMan62
Reviews.Content: This was the seventh straight year we have spent 10 days in Napa Valley for Thanksgiving, and this was the third year in a row that we stayed at the Villagio Inn and Spa in Yountville....and we hope to continue that streak. We really enjoy the relaxed elegance of the facilities and the staff. Their brunch alone is worth coming for; it's complete with great omelettes (plus waffles on holidays and weekends) and a tasteful and varied buffet with a bit of variety each day. Whether we consume any of the champagne (sparking actually) or bloody marys or not, we are ready to continue our travels throughout Napa and Sonoma well fortified. In searching for something to criticize, about the only thing I can think of is the spottiness of their wireless coverage and somewhat limited television offerings...but, hey, we're here for a vacation and these are minor irritations. We are not spa people, so can't speak to those amenities, but we love this place and look forward to returning again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in the quaint Yountville area.”
Reviews.Author: JPR2003
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on this property through Jetsetter. The grounds were beautiful, the room well appointed and laid out. The daily breakfast was an added bonus. Walking distance to everything Yountville has to offer. What a gem in Napa. We highly recommend Villagio.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Villagio!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly530
Reviews.Content: Wow! We just got back from the Villagio a few hours ago and I couldn't wait to sing their praises. I'm seriously confused as to how this hotel is ranked #4 out of 5 hotels in Yountville; my husband and I found it to be one of the greatest places we've stayed recently (especially when contrasted to the hotel in NYC we stayed in last week - double the price and no where near the service). Now, we went in the off-season so I already felt we got a steal for the hotel room ($225 a night), and then when we arrived we got upgraded to Room 101, which is right by the pool and the main building for the hotel - score! We had a lovely outdoor patio that looked out on some grape vines, a gorgeous king-size bed, a fireplace (which we used both nights and which worked flawlessly), and a spacious bathroom area. The room was immaculately clean and very quiet. The bed was so comfortable - great pillows, incredible duvet. The shower, while sort of tough for a short person to get into, had excellent water pressure, the water temperature was always right, and the provided bath amenities were large enough for two people to use them (I hate how small hotel toiletries always are). We had a bottle of chardonnay (complimentary) waiting in our room and when we arrived, were given complimentary hot chocolate. The location is great - within walking distance to all the major restaurants (Bottega, Ad Hoc, Bouchon, French Laundry) and the pool is heated and warm enough that my husband went swimming yesterday! The spa is supposed to be wonderful, but we didn't check it out this time. Breakfast, as others have raved about, is INCREDIBLE - and included in your room rate! They have their made-to-order omelet station (which had so many great offerings) and some delicious, and different, breakfast spreads. Today they had biscuits and gravy; yesterday they offered a bacon quiche. There are a great selection of pastries, toasts, bagels, spreads, and who will complain with complimentary champagne, mimosas, and bloody marys to start the day off? The best part, though, was the staff - truly friendly and helpful at every turn! My husband and I were going up there to finally eat at French Laundry and I was beyond excited. When we got there, we needed to have his blazer dry cleaned, and they called the dry cleaner to confirm that he could come pick it up and return it early so that we could make our dinner seating. When it was returned from the dry cleaner, one of their staff immediately brought it to our room so that I didn't even have to stress out or worry! Given that I had had a HORRIBLE experience with a hotel dry cleaning service in Austria several years ago (which resulted in us missing the first half of The Nutcracker at the Opera House in Vienna), having this peace of mind meant so much to me! I was going to go over there to check on the dry cleaning at 4:10 (they said it would be back at 4:00), but they delivered it promptly to the room at about 3:55 PM and I couldn't have been happier (also, their prices were really reasonable - $10 for a blazer?!? I'm used to paying twice that at a hotel). My husband also accidentally left his workout clothes in the hotel room after we checked out (he was drying them on the patio and we forgot about them) and they were great about tracking the clothes down and shipping them to us so that we could get those back. When we asked about the best way to get from the hotel to French Laundry, they offered to call us a trolley and when we asked how we'd get back from the restaurant, they said to simply call the front desk and they'd send the trolley to pick us up (we ended up walking but they were just so helpful!). Honestly, when I checked out this morning I asked to be added to their e-mail list. As we live in San Francisco, if I saw a decent price on the hotel on short notice (or even with advance notice), I'd go back up there just to stay by the pool or use the spa facilities. It was an incredible deal - we've probably spent 40-50 nights this year in various hotels and my husband said it was "one of the best hotel values we've had". I agree. Without a doubt, we will return to the Villagio!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa property w/in walking distance of all”
Reviews.Author: lbe570
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights lower room close to spa. Nice 2 story property w/ close parking and rooms are very close to spa, which is the best. Rooms have patio, nice in summer to sit. Very quiet, w/ pool, cabanas. Rooms are very comfortable w/ fireplace, fluffy beds, big bathroom. The only problem we had was the heater sounded like a jet engine at night. Said they fixed it, but stil the same. Should have had them move us. Wonderful breakfast w/ omletes, fruits, pastries, oatmeal, yogurt, potatoes. High tea at 3 and wine at 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms near great food”
Reviews.Author: Calgirl74
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second stay at the Villagio. The rooms are large with comfy beds (great duvets) and I love the in-room Nespresso machines and complimentary bottle of wine. The breakfast is DELICIOUS, with, in addition to an omelette station, more interesting items like beet salad, salmon mousse and banana bread pudding on offer (plus made to order lattes). There's no onsite restaurant, but the room service menu was tasty (especially the salmon - yum). The grounds are fine, but the location is phenomenal if you are a food and wine lover. Would not bring my young kids here because I'd feel like we were disturbing people, but it's great for couples or corporate events. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful inn”
Reviews.Author: cliffview12
Reviews.Content: We drove up from LA and got in around 7pm and were exhausted after the long drive. As I was checking in at the front desk the bartender Allen came over with a wine spritzer--my hero! We had a lovely inner courtyard room. Fireplace, sitting area, nice tub. The grounds were wonderful also. Nice pool area. The breakfast buffet the next morning was super. Omelet station, fresh fruit, homemade pastries, breakfast meats, potatoes. All wonderful. They also served champagne upon request (we didn't imbibe as we were going wine tasting later!) They have a vineyard that you can walk around, so my husband and I tried to walk off our breakfast. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: drumdan2002
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great location. The grounds are beautiful as are the rooms. Would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Visit to Villagio”
Reviews.Author: S12335
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villagio Inn and Spa in October. We stayed in an upper room near the end of the complex. The grounds were beautiful. The spa was great. I slept in 4 different hotels while staying in California. By far, Villagio had the most comfortable bed (king bed). I did hear a little road noise but it wasn't too bad. Had hope to work out in the gym but was disappointed in the gym that was available. I decided not to use it after seeing it. The breakfast was excellent and we had no problems with finding seats.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not quite worth the price”
Reviews.Author: eteyemd
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very happy with our stay at Villagio. The grounds are quite peaceful and attractive. Its a little close to the highway but to be honest we never really noticed it at all. The rooms are nice and large but the walls are a little on the thin side. We could always hear people walking in the room above us or talking in the room next to us. It really wasn't a big issue, just noticeable. The beds were very comfortable and the Nepresso machine is a nice touch to go along with the regular coffee. The morning breakfast is certainly all its hyped up to be. A wonderful selection of food served in buffet style with a made to order omelette if you like. Its location is great and you can easily walk to many surrounding restaurants and winery tasting rooms. The staff was quite good and always friendly. I would certainly stay here again but I'm not quite sure if its worth the price we paid for it. Everything was great but the value is juuuuust below what you expect.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Heaven”
Reviews.Author: cardiophys
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to visit and stay at Villagio Inn for a friend's wedding. Driving from SFO was very nice as we took the northern HWY 1 route over GGB. First opinion of the hotel was mixed, checked in at 6pm, there was a piano player and people lounging in the lobby enjoying wine. The lobby is quite small which I will later expand on. Check-in was standard however there was no explanation of the breakfast and tea service which is included in hotel rate of $500/night. The room they gave us had double beds when I specifically requested for a a king. Went back to the front desk nd after much discussion the manager "found" a king bed room but we were warned that is was next to HWY 29. The rooms are splendid and spacious. The highlight is the fireplace!! The negative is that the bed is too soft! Had to adjust wit pillows to avoid back pain. The breakfast is included and is wonderful. The best omelete I have had in quite some time. The problem is that they try to cram all guests into the above mentioned small lobby during breakfast. You will have to get there early or late for a table otherwise you will have to stand and eat breakfast. Not something ideal when you pay $500/night. Drove around Yountville an dvisited some vineyards as part of the wedding plans. MUST STOP at Oakville grocery store and get a sandwich, very impressed by this place. Stop by there and get food as you tour wine country. In summary, nice place, if hotel is reading this please consider upgrading the bedding and adding on to main lobby to expand breakfast area. Room is splendid otherwise. Will visit again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for wine tasting!”
Reviews.Author: cheryl5418
Reviews.Content: Villagio was a very nice hotel. The service was great. The rooms were big and remodeled (it is an older place). The breakfast was fantastic. The pool was smallish, but ok. The hotel is walkable to many great restaurants and bars including Bouchon and Bottega. The town seems like a good central spot for wine tasting. The one thing that bothered me is that I am not sure the hotel was worth the price we paid (regular rack rate). It was a little steep. Our friends were there on a group rate for a convention and I would of felt much better with their rate! Overall it is a nice hotel and a great spot for a Napa wine tasting trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, best breakfast ever and the most wonderful concierge!”
Reviews.Author: passioninlife
Reviews.Content: The Villagio is a lovely hotel right in the heart of Yountville, Napa Valley. It is a bit larger than the boutique hotels we generally like to stay in, but it had many amenites that made it stand out. One was the amazing concierge, Mary. Mary helped to make our trip special. She worked with us to find us just the right reservations for dinner (including the French Laundry) and wine tours. Next, the breakfast...It was so amazing! The freshness and variety of the dishes were second to none. In addition, there were tea times and wine and cheese tastings complimentary as well. Our room was very nice, a bottle of wine waiting for us in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: tnt-la
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weeked to celebrate our anniversary. From the time we checked in to when we left, everything was wonderful! Very nice and helpful staff - yummy breakfast every morning. Our room was larger than I had expected and very clean, and the grounds and pool area were gorgeous. The location is perfect for wine tasting excursions during the day and within walking distance of fabulous restaurants for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Anniversay get-away”
Reviews.Author: Henry T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 20th anniversary in Napa Valley and could not have been more pleased. We went in October which is peak season but did not feel overcrowded. The hotel has one of the best manicured grounds we have experienced, including our trips in Europe. The ambience of the very tastefully designed and furnished buildings, flower filled gardens and backdrop of rolling hills of vineyards rivals any place in Tuscany. The rooms were of spacious, well furnished and very tastefully decorated. The location was perfect with many great vineyards in less than 10 minutes drive. Within walking distance are great restaurants such as French Laundry, Botegga and Redd. Also a few shops to browse and buy unique items and gifts. We enjoyed the spa for a massage and just relaxing. Excellent service and very accommodating. There are two things that could be negatives. We did not like our bed. Too soft. By the third day, I had a backache but it was too late to ask them to do anything. There can also be a bit of road noise from highway 29. The do hide it a bit with a fountain that runs the length of the property but it is still noticeable at night. The buffet breakfast (included in the price) could be better but the Bloody Mary is the best I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kmboulet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a wonderful stay at this lovely inn. From check in, to check out everything was great. They nice hotel staff greeted me at check in with a glass of champagne. Breakfast every morning was delicious. Afternoon tea, yummy! Our room was was spacious, clean and romantic. The service was out of this world. On the last night of our hotel stay, the in room movie system stopped working. The IT department went over and above to try and fix the system. They were unable to fix and I just did not feel like changing rooms since it was our last night.The hotel staff surprised us with a DVD player, a wide selection of movies from blockbuster and bowl of popcorn. They totally went out of there way to keep us happy and I really appreciated it. Can't go wrong with this inn!

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 201MZ
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel from service, breakfast, pool, location. Hands down - only place to stay. Breakfast is amazing - Pool is heated -

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Ratpack71
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days at Villagio. Loved the accommodations. Great location. Enjoyed the included breakfast buffet and omelet station, with the bloody mary's and champagne cocktails. The rooms were clean, spacious and included a Nespresso machine and regular coffee. The health spa was immaculate. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: Redtide1
Reviews.Content: For nearly $400/night we expected much more. Not even the complimentary bottle of wine could dull our disappointment. Poorly furnished, dimly lit, noisy suite with a view of scraggly bushes. Woke to highway traffic and beeping of trucks. Sounded like it was garbage day. In fairness the bed was very comfortable. There are much better choices in Yountville. Had we booked more than one night we would have promptly checked out. Over hyped and under delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and more!!”
Reviews.Author: MARISASELLS
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Unreal breakfast , omellette station with cocktails! Afternoon tea with mini sandwiches Fruit pastries.awesome pool , quaint lobby bar. Spa was amazing. The spa suite was also outstanding. Would go back without a doubt !

Reviews.Title: “Cutest Romantic Stay”
Reviews.Author: MV05
Reviews.Content: The Inn has a great location, just off Santa Helena Highway and minutes from wineries. You can walk to Le Bouchon for dinner or grab fresh baked goods at the bakery. I loved everything about the hotel. Our room had a chimney which made it very romantic. Everybodys pictures posted on this site are exactly what I found. Beautiful hotel. The breakfast buffet is a feast!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and we cant wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: lauren g
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villagio sept 1-5 and had an amazing time!!! The hotel is wonderful, service was marvelous as well as the amenities. We LOVED the champagne breakfast every morning and enjoyed scones and the pool after our winery tours in the afternoon. The location is great, we were able to walk to our restaurants every night. I have no complaints. Cant wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: jkuryak
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Villagio for another relaxing 5 days. Love staying in Yountville for the proximity to restaurants in the evening. The Villagio always does a nice job. Start the day with their champagne breakfast, get ready each day with a visit to the spa facility, and relax by the pool. Looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: foodiegirl050
Reviews.Content: We always chose to stay in Yountville when we visit Napa Valley but this was out first stay at The Villagio Inn. The hotel is lovely and upon check in we were upgraded to a suite and greeted with a fun cocktail! The grounds, pool and spa are all well appointed and spotless. Each room has a fireplace and housekeeping leaves a little duraflame each night at turn down. You may think August a fire?? It was downright cold at night and we made a fire every night. Our Spa Day your way was AWESOME! We had a private balcony with an outdoor fireplace, our own jacuzzi tubs and we were brought some amazing food and a glass of champagne!! The BEST was the amazing breakfast included in your room rate: unlimited champagne and bloodies, omelet and waffle stations....this meal sets you up for a day of wine tasting! My ONLY warning- CHECK all your bills! We had booked spa treatments (which they actually never put in their book when I called to confirm it so call to check on your bookings), I asked the girl on the phone the exact price which matched what their website says. She said the gratuity was included so I asked her to give me EXACTLY what it would cost. ( I was putting cash aside to pay). When I went to pay at the spa the price was $20 more per person! I spoke to the Spa manager and she handled it PERFECTLY! She was pleasant and refunded us right away. Same at check out- my bill had completely higher room rates then we were confirmed at. Luckily I saved my email confirmation from the hotel. Again it was a pain, but the front desk handled it quickly and pleasantly! I would absolutely stay here next time we visit Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Yountville location near world-class restaurants”
Reviews.Author: writeholt
Reviews.Content: This is a Romantic spot catering to adults on a wine-tour of the Napa Valley. If you choose, sleep in and take advantage of your in-room fireplace or start your morning with the extensive complimentary breakfast. The spa was recently redone and you will be within walking distance of all of Yountivlle's fine restaurants including Redd, Bistro Jeanty, Bouchon, Bottega and the world famous French Laundry.

Reviews.Title: “A nice value and a great location”
Reviews.Author: pmoed
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I) booked a trip to the Villagio thru Hotels.com and got a very good rate ($250/night) for a 4 night stay in August. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms are huge and the decor is cute. We didn't have any issue with highway noise. I do wish the room was a bit brighter and had a better view. The champagne breakfast each morinng was lovely with omelets and waffles made to order. The pool was beautiful with several big daybeds to lie on under big canopies. The location of the hotel is great. You can walk to fabulous restaurants and Yountville is adorable. Access to the vineyards is easy too. The real highlight for us was the spa. It was really, really nice. I had a Tranquility treatment which was soooo relaxing. I am so glad that we didn't spend 2 or three times the price for other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Virtually could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Ebbhead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few days here in early August and our experience could not have been better. The service was exemplary from the moment we checked in until the moment we drove off the property. The concierges spent a fair amount of time with us sanity checking our winery itineraries and made some amazing suggestions on others. Our first night there, the concierge was able to get us a reso at Bottega for 7pm, which set the tone for a week of amazing food. The included breakfasts were always great, with ample fruit and cereals, an omelet station, pastries and some hot foods. The mimosas and Bloody Marys were free-flowing for those partaking. There was an afternoon tea, which we attended only on the first day, which included finger sandwiches and small pastries. Though the pool area was small, we were always able to get a chair in the sun (or the shade, when we wanted that) and it was always well-attended to. Towels were constantly refreshed, and water, lemonade and iced tea were always on hand, and the wait staff was able to attend to any other needs. There was a second pool we did not use behind the old spa location which is available for guests when not reserved for other parties or events. The grounds were meticulously kept. While we expected the location to be set a bit further back from the street, this turned out not to be a problem at all as there was never any noticeable street noise, and we were a (very!) short walk from all of the amazing restaurants of Yountville. The mens' spa was small, but well-kept and more than sufficient, including an outdoor hydrotherapy pool and a fireplace, which I guess is used in colder months. The staff at the spa were always great. My wife had made the appointments for us and another couple we were with, and all of us were supposed to have had female masseuses, and all wound up with male ones. While not an issue, it was perhaps the only surprise of the stay there and was not as booked. The V-Shops area opened late and closed early, as seemed to be the case with most of Yountville, which seemed a missed opportunity, as we were out at tastings during their entire operating hours virtually every day. We stayed in an interior courtyard room and while the view was as the room is named, it felt very separated from neighboring rooms, quite, spacious and luxurious. While security was never a remote concern, we did think it odd that there was just a single deadbolt on the door. While the bedding was great, I thought the mattress could have used an extra layer of padding, though I guess that's personal preference. Similarly, I found the pillows a bit too soft, but I'm a side or stomach sleeper, so I tend to have issues finding a pillow that I love. Again, likely an issue of personal preference. The hotel uses a ground courier service to ship wine, and we were able to leave the bottles in the room with the form filled out and they took care of it without us having to lug anything to the front desk. Upon checkout, the always pleasant front desk staff checked us in to our flight, pre-paid for our checked luggage and printed our boarding passes for us.

Reviews.Title: “Classy But Not Stuffy”
Reviews.Author: joyjim
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Villagio and I can't imagine staying anywhere else when visiting the Napa Valley. The inn is beautiful with all the waterscapes and landscaping, the room is spacious (love the big bathroom) and the patios are lovely (ask for one with privacy hedges near a waterscape). And with the delicious complimentary breakfast, I think it's a great value too. The town of Yountville is charming and you can walk to great restaurants every night of the week. The pool area is very nice with lots of covered areas and there is a nearby tennis court (we didn't use it this time though) and access to a workout facility (didn't use that either but should have!). Staff is friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful part of wine country - relaxing base for Napa”
Reviews.Author: Flit_Wing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights and part of the draw was the proximity to French Laundry (walking distance). The Villagio is in a small quiet village and it is off a busy highway that runs through the valley but because of the landscaping, fountains and layout it feels completely secluded. The rooms were very spacious and each had a balcony/garden that was oriented for maximum privacy. The pool was very warm and inviting and the chairs around it the perfect spot to lounge after an arduous day of wine tasting. The breakfast was phenomenal including a generous buffet of fruits, meats, cheeses, baked goods, made to order omelets and waffles, espresso drinks etc. As a confirmed coffee drinker I also made good use of the espresso maker in the room. My favorite thing may have been the bed - it was gorgeous to open the balcony and windows and get a cross breeze and fall asleep in an extremely comfortable bed. My least favorite thing was the strange staff hierarchy. It was hard to get anything done because all tasks seemed to be delegated and take forever. We wondered if it was some strange union rules at play. We hiked on some trails north of this hotel up into the cliffy hills and I would highly recommend that for anyone who enjoys hikes. We also ate at a fun hamburger joint off the highway in Geyserville or very close to it. We visited some friends in Sonoma which is a busier scene and offers a lot of nightlife but I prefer the quieter and considerably smaller Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel so much, we came back a 3rd time.”
Reviews.Author: patriotic
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all the hotels in Yountville and think that based on the charm of the Napa area and value, Villagio is the best. First, the parking is free and abundant. The resort is very peaceful and serene, with the internal fountains and landscaping giving it a real Tuscan-inspired feel. Also, the afternoon tea and inclusive breakfast service is amazing. The breakfast served here is the nicest one I've experienced that was included in the room price. I think the rooms are very charming. It's hard to beat the allure of the wood-burning fireplaces. The beds are super comfy. I loved the espresso machine (nice touch) so much that I purchased one for home. Love it. The hotel pool is also very nice and I have used the spa services on several occasions and the spa is also fantastic. If there is one negative, I agree that the A/C noise is a little annoying. The hotel location cannot be beat, as it is centrally-located amongst several of the best restaurants in Yountville. The town is small, quaint and quiet. We live within an hours drive and it's so convenient for a quick getaway. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and would definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: dsbrcs
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this place, Clean, friendly, comfortable beds and bedding. the rooms were great because they were like a suite with plenty of space to move around and have places to sit. We loved how you opened the french doors to our patio and allowed the breeze to flow through the room. the buffet breakfast was great. always tea, lemon water and water free. i know that might not sound like much but when you have to pay five dollars for a bottle of water from your mini bar in a 5 star hotel...it was just a nice thoughtful touch. the town is so clean and manicured with cute little shops and restaurants within walking distance. we were definately not disappoinyed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to returning-highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: nexttripleez
Reviews.Content: Villagio Inn is a fabulous hotel. This was our first visit and won't be the last. Beautiful property--flowers everywhere. Spacious, clean rooms, with mini-fridge. Service excellent. Our only regret was having to leave. Very helpful concierge in finding excellent last minute dinner options. Be sure to request inner courtyard room away from highway if having a quiet location is important to you. Balcony was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service on Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Wine00
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lit of hotels in Napa an found this to be the best service and location

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: JackieDS5
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Villagio. The included breakfast was WONDERFUL! The grounds are lovely, and you can walk to lots of places - shopping, dining, etc. True luxury - our room was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: EricandSusan0413
Reviews.Content: Inn is absolutely beautiful. Service and attitude are excellent. We plan to return over and over. Very nice touches you don't read about. AND, the buffet breakfast is superb. Everything is clean, clean, clean. If road noise bothers you, book an interior courtyard room instead of exterior. View from interior room is nicer, too. (Road noise is only bothersome early in the morning.) You will instantly relax and say Ahhhhhhhhh as soon as you get there!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Villagio”
Reviews.Author: hajiblue72
Reviews.Content: We recently took our first trip to Napa and stayed at Villagio based on a referral from a friend. Overall we had a fantastic stay and would definitely return. The breakfast in the morning is wonderful. Our rooms were excellent, clean and the bed was the best we have had in a hotel. Pool was great and landscaping is beautiful. The spa, even though we didn't use it much, is wonderful and they have amazing multi-head showers to use. The service was great and everyone was very friendly. The location is outstanding, as you can walk to 10 or 12 outstanding restaurants. The only issue at all is it does back up to Highway 29 - it did not bother us at all but the other couple we stayed with did move from a unit that backed up to the highway into the middle of the complex due to the noise. Being our first trip we don't have basis for comparison, but were extremely happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “over priced but great location”
Reviews.Author: jingeorgia
Reviews.Content: Our room was dark and the bathroom was very dated but the inn is so well located that it bothered us less and less the longer we were there. We had been warned about noise, but that was not a problem probably because the noise of the a/c's blower blocked all outside noise. Our sitting area outside was a lovely spot for relaxing and reading in the filtered afternoon sun. The fireplace was a nice touch at bedtime and the champagne breakfasts were a delicious and delightful way to start the day. The pool area is also a nice feature. Hotel bargains are not easy to come by in Yountville, but not having to drive to dinner takes a little of the sting out of the pocket book!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: kristi34607
Reviews.Content: Love love love this place! Great location on the main drag in Yountville. The rates were quite reasonable given the location. Both the accommodations and the service were excellent. And the breakfast- awesome and included! I would love to stay there in the summer and take advantage of the pool. We looked forward to returning each day after wine tasting and exploring to this comfortable, quiet property!

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable stay of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: CBea3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Villagio Inn & Spa with my mother and we absolutely loved it! It far surpassed our expectations of what a great getaway should include: our room was spacious and clean, staff was friendly, food was delicious, and the spa was world class! The bell boy that brought our bags to our room was very knowledgeable about the area, gave us a map with places circled, times and locations for specific events. It was nice to have a fireplace in our room and a balcony that overlooked beautiful fountains. Everything was easily accessible; there were restaurants across the street and wineries down the road. Everyone should indulge in the Villagio’s breakfast buffet, if not for the amazing variety of dishes, then for the yummy Bloody Mary’s and Mimosas offered! The only negative part about this trip is that we had to leave!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel for five star price”
Reviews.Author: CAL31M
Reviews.Content: I suppose if this hotel were half the price they are charging, I would give it a better review. Unfortunately, it is not. I have stayed in a lot of nice hotels in this price range and was disappointed in this one. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is right in the heart of Yountville with great restaurants across the street and a few blocks away. Yountville is a cute little town that is much quieter and smaller than nearby St. Helena. On the plus side Mary the concierge was great. They have a decent breakfast buffet. The rooms have fireplaces which are nice. However, the rooms all face out into one another, so the balconies/patios have no privacy and the rooms are kind of dark. The first room we had was dark and looked out onto a wall, so the front desk staff tried to be helpful and find us a better room. The second room looked out into other patios/rooms but had marginally more light so we settled for that one (nothing else was available). The room decor was a bit bland and it had a noisy old fashioned heater rather than a thermostat with forced air heating. I didn't try the spa so I can't comment on that. I wouldn't stay here again because of the quality of the rooms were poor in relation to the price.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest honeymoon and anniversary we could ever want”
Reviews.Author: kingern61
Reviews.Content: The Villagio inn and spa is too wonderful for me to review in detail or my review would be about five pages long. As simple as i can say is, the rooms are comfortable and romantic. The fireplaces in each room are a lovely touch and the balcony views of the courtyard are also very enjoyable. The grounds of the villagio are everything you would expect from visiting napa valley. They have their own minature vineyard on the front lawn, and the surround area and gardens are well manicured. its just an all out great feeling to be at this location. Another thing i cant rave enough about is the town of younteville where it lies. The town has some of the best restaurants you can find in napa and the main street to get to them is all walking distance, no matter where you are. There is a market that sells alcohol, snacks and gourmet cheeses and whatnot directly across the street, which of course is another authentic napa experience you must enjoy while visiting. I highly recommend visitng Boatega restaurant in younteville for it is to this day one of my absolute favorite restaurants ive been to in any state or country. the food is phenomenal and the atmosphere is absolutly perfect. Back to the villagio their champage breakfast couldnt do you any better. they offer anything and everything ones heart could desire, and their dining area in the lobby is a pleasant place to start off your day. The made to order omelette station is fast and taste great, and the champagne is pour your own..so enjoy that! :) each day we were amazingly happy with the turn down service to our room. they cleaned and replenished multiple times a day as we came and went. The coffee machines in the bathrooms were a great thing to enjoy, and the complimentary bottle of chardoney apon arrival was much enjoyed. The pool and hottub are big enough, clean enough and comfortable enough. As you can tell this is my absolute favorite place to stay and visit, we have returned three times and will again soon enough, however the price seems to continue to climb so I really must suggest they try and keep it managable for all parties. I would happily pay 300 dollars per night for a regular room here and have in the past. we paid 500+ per night for an upstairs suite our first visit for our honeymoon...but the hotel now is averaging somewhere in between those prices just for a regular nights stay not even in a "price location" which unfortionatly is asking a bit much. please management, if you would like your loving customers to continue to make it back, try to keep the prices managebale for all. We happily will travel across the country from massachusetts yearly to stay at your hotel alone, as long as its affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal.”
Reviews.Author: tinat168
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villagio for a girlfriends' weekend getaway and received a great deal. This place surpassed all of my expectations! We spent a solid 3-4 hours at the Spa, which is beautifully appointed, and the staff was very welcoming. I had a deep tissue massage that was sublime. It really was the perfect spa day to share with friends. Our room (interior courtyard) was very spacious, and we were welcomed with a bottle of Chardonnay, which I think was from Oakville. Surprisingly very tasty! The hot tub and pool were divine. The hotel is conveniently located right in the heart of Yountville, and we walked to Bottega for a fabulous dinner. Now, the best part of the Villagio is their breakfast buffet, which is included with the room!! Not only was the food SPECTACULAR (officially obsessed with their banana bread pudding!!), but the bottomless mimosas and bloody mary's (made with Absolut Pepar) were well appreciated by our group. Omelette station? Yes please! If you can afford the price, I would highly recommend this place -- the breakfast buffet won me over (in addition to the friendly service, gorgeous grounds, location, spa, and rooms).

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Romantic Getaway”
