Reviews.Author: MrsBAM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and were very fortunate to stumble upon the Villagio. The hotel we had previously booked in Napa was awful, so we drove around hoping to find somewhere better to stay. The staff was extremely helpful and sympathetic to our situation. They not only gave us a discount, but an upgraded room for our honeymoon. The room was very spacious with a balcony, sitting room, fireplace, and jacuzzi tub. The bathroom and dressing area were spacious as well with plenty of drawer space for our things. The concierge was very helpfu in making reservations and offering advice on what to do in the area. We had expressed intrest in going to the French Laundry, but of course last minute reservations there are near impossible. I was very impressed when one morning at breakfast the concierge came over to us to let us know he had a cancellation and offered it to us. (Unfortunately, the reservation was for after we were leaving, but still very nice of him to remember us and offer.) The grounds at the hotel are beautiful with lovely courtyards, fountains, and arbors. The pool was fabulous with great beds and chairs to loung on. The breakfast was over the top. I have never seen a free breakfast at a hotel like this. They had mimosas and bloody marys, as well as an omelet station and lots of food. You cannot beat the location of this hotel as well. It is in walking distance to many restaurants and wine tasting rooms. There are also many amny vinyards all within a 15 min drive or less. We would love to come back to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: gretchendarling
Reviews.Content: Understated elegance. Loved feeling pampered yet not smothered. We did NOT want a city feel or an over the top luxury like we were in a Donald Trump facility. What we wanted was to be relaxed and taken care of in an understated way and that was exactly what we achieved. The spa was wonderful, too.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: newtonmatraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during a week long trip to Napa. The hotel is quite lovely and the staff excellent. It was a good value (although this is relative for Napa Valley). The rooms are large and well appointed and the amenities excellent. The breakfast buffet in the morning was excellent, the Spa quite nice and pool lovely. We picked this hotel mostly due to location. You can walk to just about everything in Yountville so we able to leave our car in the parking lot unused most days. There are several great restaurants within walking distance (most just a few yards). Among them are Red, Ad Hoc, Bistro Jeanty, Botegga, and the French Laundry. Make sure to book a table as soon as you make a hotel reservation since it is impossible to get them last minute. We booked (on open table) almost two months in advance and still had to take less than favorable times even though it was on a midweek night and off season. Our favorite activity (other than wine tastings) was to rent a bike from Napa Valley Wine Tours and ride through the vineyards of Napa. The valley is flat so the riding is easy and the roads have extra wide shoulders for bike paths. You can walk to the bike shop from the hotel. If you are decent shape you can ride to St Helena and back in about two hours. We did that one day, stopping at a few wineries and the Mustard Grill for Lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff in a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaNYC3
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nicest staff ever! Every single employee here went out of their way to greet you and offer assistance. Great champagne (or bloody mary, mimosa) breakfast every morning (multiple options) Most nights have a couple hours of wine and cheese Large lounge lobby with fireplace, tea/coffee Heated Pool and access to a gym next door Right by running paths Very large clean rooms with fire places (this is not a plush city hotel, but a very nicely kept country/lodge style room) Great location for walking to lunch and dinner Wonderful spa amenities Wine in your room upon arrival Great price when compared to other hotels in the area of Yountville Cons: None!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful retreat in the heart of Yountville”
Reviews.Author: jackisnotdull
Reviews.Content: The Villagio Inn and Spa is the perfect base for touring the Napa Valley in true style and comfort. The hotel's concierge, Mary DuVoure was exceptional in assisting us with charting out our wine tasting route and restaurant bookings. Her recommendations were spot on and we had a fabulous time. Their champagne breakfast is also a wonderful way to start the day, and you can come back during tea for their complimentary afternoon tea service which is a very nice touch. I also loved that there was a gym nearby which we could use to work of the excess calories and they offered Spinning and Yoga classes which was a bonus. It was also fun to light our own fireplace in the room when we returned from dinner...very romantic an memorable. Can't speak any higher of this lovely retreat set in the heart of gorgeous wine country. - we booked our room through Jetsetter which gave us a great rate and a large junior suite downstairs, do check online for special rates. For my full review on The Villagio Inn and Spa and Mary's superb recommendations, view my post: http://jackisnotdull.com/2010/12/24/top-things-to-…in-napa-valley/

Reviews.Title: “I feel like I'm coming home, only with better service and a nicer bed”
Reviews.Author: FounderBelle
Reviews.Content: Every year, I return to the Villagio where we run a big conference over a week. Every year, I am more impressed with the service the staff manage to provide for us. Nothing ever seems like too much of a problem - including staff pitching in to help us open 200 bottles of wine for a wine tasting exam every morning at 6.30am. The bedrooms are spacious, very clean, and the beds are just heavenly - I love to sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Collins60795
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and nice. We received white chocolate cocco upon arrival and they upgraded our room. A really wonderful way to start our vacation! The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The pool was heated and warm. The jacuzzi was relaxing. However, the one in the spa was better. Guests of the hotel are allowed to use the facilities at the spa which I highly suggest!! The showers are amazing :) The room was quite large but cozy. The comp wine was nice to drink by the fireplace or on the patio. My one complaint was the noise. We could hear all the foot traffic upstairs very loud. I would also recommend not getting a room on the side of 29 if possible. Luckily, we had one of the inside rooms but could still hear the traffic. The breakfast was great! It's a must!! It had everything you could want and filled you up before hitting the wineries. Great location in downtown Yountville. Walking distance to Ad Hoc and Bouchon. 15 min or less drive to all the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugSoCal1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great experience at this hotel. The grounds are beautiful, with a Tuscan atmosphere. The pool is very nice and peaceful. We stayed in an upstairs suite. It was very private, and had plenty of room. Both the bedroom and bathroom were very large and nice and clean. The bed was also extremely comfortable. We usually stay in downtown Napa, but we decided this time to stay in a hotel that was situated more privately, because it was our wedding, and we ended up taking a lot of awesome pictures. I liked the private feel of Yountville, and this hotel. The quaint town of Yountville with shops, world-class restaurants and a couple of bars are right outside. One of the best parts of this hotel is the Mumm champagne breakfast. The breakfast room is incredibly pretty. You can sit outside and drink champagne, eat a great breakfast and look at vineyards all morning. We did not want to leave to go wine tasting! We are already planning a trip back to this hotel for next June. We had a great experience and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Tom109
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the entrance to the the moment we left, everything was just so spot on. We were greeted by exceptionally friendly staff and the standard of service was consistently high throughout our stay. Being a big fan of mediterranean architectures, I found the setting and the interior really impressive. The room was well decorated and came with a cheeky complimentary bottle of vino. That went down well. Some of America's finest eateries are located by a short walk (if not a few minutes drive) which includes the French Laundry. I fondly remember the hot tub that was opened until late at night. Great treat after a heavy meal! All in all I have a very good memory of Villagio and would certainly not hesitate to revisit it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Christmas at Villagio”
Reviews.Author: cafferiello
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent the Christmas weekend at Villagio Inn & Spa, we loved the place, lots of amenities, one pleasant surprise after another and the staff made our stay memorable. It was our first time in Napa Valley and we loved every moment. The Spa really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Sri_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at villagio, which was located in the heart of yountville. Top restaurants bouchon, bistro jeanty, hurleys and the overrated bottega are all less than 0.5 miles of the property. In addition to great service you also get free breakfast, bottle of wine and complimentary coffee and scones (in the afternoon). The spa is extremely relaxing and I would highly recommend this spot for first time visitors and seasoned pro's as well. A lot of good wineries too are located in close proximity to villagio, which makes this ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dkj160
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay and felt that it was a remarkably good value. The wine and cheese tasting in the evening and the large breakfast buffet was a pleasant surprise. Our room was very large with 30 ft. ceilings and a fireplace. It was a little dark in the afternoon and there was some road noise but I put on Pandora and all was good. Ask for a room away from the road if you think it will bother you. The spa was lovely, very warm and inviting for women travelers in particular. The steam, sauna, and outdoor hot tub were perfect. They invite you to sample their spa scrub bar which is nice. The lounge area off the spa had cozy chairs, fireplace, snacks, magazines. I could have stayed all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Villagio”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaWalnut
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Villagio. It was mostly a business trip, but we did get in a little bit of wine tasting. The room was spacious and inviting. I enjoyed the amenities like the espresso maker in the room, complimentary breakfast and wine on arrival. I was also offered a delicious cup of hot chocolate when I arrived. The lobby is warm and inviting, and the grounds are beautiful. Overall, I highly recommend the Villagio for a great stay in the Napa valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - at the right price”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many places in Yountville but never here as I couldn't justify paying double the rate at Yountville Inn or Napa Valley Lodge. But at <$200 it was worth a try and very enjoyable. Beds were extremely comfortable and rooms very spacious. Bathroom was a little dark but large and well laid-out; if I were paying their standard $400+ I'd expect a glass-walled shower, but this was just in the tub. Several pools were nicely heated during my cool December stay, and the showers and hot tubs at their relativley new spa were outstanding. Breakfast was filling with made-to-order omelets, mimosas, etc and the staff provided excellent service. Well worth returning at a fair price, and of course the downtown Yountville location can't be beat, whereever you choose to stay in town!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay -- This is where you want to stay in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: cocco89
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to wine country, we stayed at Villagio and Bardessono. I would highly recommend Villagio if you are choosing between the two. We found great deals on both and decided to see what each offers. We are used to staying at luxury hotels and this one did not fall short. The rooms are not lavish but spacious and decorated to match the relaxing surroundings. Our room was upstairs facing one of the courtyards. It was quiet and peaceful with a beatiful balcony and wood burning fireplace. The breakfast alone is worth staying here. It is a short walk to all of Yountville's fabulous restaurants. From the breakfast staff to the concierege, service here is second to none,

Reviews.Title: “What a Joke, don't be fooled.”
Reviews.Author: petercmodestoCA
Reviews.Content: Can you say remodled Super 8? How gullible can you be to think this is anything more? Number one, this is a old Super 8 or Motel 6 with a fountain added and some faux paint. Number two , this place is slammed on a freeway. Complete sleepless night. And no, they will not move you when asked. Number three, mediocre service right up there with Ramada. Not to knock Ramada who has service = to price point but this place is $450 a night. The biggest hotel rip-off of my life.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: greenliberalblue
Reviews.Content: Villagio is fabulous. We did move rooms from our original assignment, to the other side of the fountains away from the road, because we are country folk and used to complete silence. The room was beautiful, the bed so comfortable, and the staff could not be nicer or more helpful. The breakfast was amazing, and could hold you for all day (I'm a Yankee cheapskate) until your Bouchon or Farmstead reservation. The spa is wonderful, esp. the lemon verbena steam. I love this place and will return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great spa”
Reviews.Author: familyofsixNJ
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice, need a little updating but made up for it with the spa and the breakfast. We did not spend much time in the room, got up early for the breakfast buffet which was unbelievable, and toured the wineries which were all so close. Great restaurants all within walking distance, French Laundry etc.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: pickyvisitor63
Reviews.Content: We stayed her last month as a treat and what a treat it was. The staff are friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The concierge was helpful and recommended a fabulous wine tasting. The champagne breakfast was delicious as was the afternoon tea. The room was huge and the bed was comfortable, they even provide a fridge to chill your white wine. We found the whole stay very relaxing, we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty in the center of Yountville”
Reviews.Author: HershieK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights for a mom's weekend getaway and loved everyday! The grounds are beautiful, the spa made us feel pampered and welcome with beautiful decor and setting. Our champagne breakfast every morning had a lovely selection of fresh juices, made to order eggs and on the weekend made to order waffles with freshly whipped cream and all the toppings you could choose! I normally skip included breakfasts because the food isn't worth the calories but this made me feel well taken care of every morning and we enjoyed eating out on the terrace. The staff were all quite lovely and eager to answer questions, always greeting me with good morning or have a good day and the convenient location was perfect for all we wanted to do! I highly recommend this hotel. NOTE: Yountville sits right near the main hwy into wine country so you will hear some noise from the road because the Villagio sits on that side of town, however they have filled the grounds with fountains to help. If you want to sit outside on your porch everyday and linger with quiet conversation, the noise may bother you, however, the grounds and service were beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a lovely town”
Reviews.Author: KarenfromMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Villagio Inn and Spa was chosen for us by friends who were getting married in Napa and from the moment we entered the reception were delighted by the Italian style architecture and friendly staff. The Villagio was very busy, being a weekend in peak season, but the resort layout of the buildings, the plush greenery and the crowded pool made you instantly feel like you were on holidays and as we were on a fairly rushed and short trip, we wished we could stay longer. The rooms are large and spacious with a comfortable bed. Yountville was delightful to us, and although it is a town of restaurants and wineries, it is upmarket and not at all "cheesy touristy". Our only complaint was that at 12.20pm, at night, returning to the hotel, we were told by an unfriendly night receptionist that he did not have anything left on the room service menu and suggested Bucheon, assuring us it was still open. We walked to the restaurant but they had just closed, Upon returning to the hotel and asking again if there was anything at all for room service, he reluctantly agreed to a pizza. Over half an hour later, an unedible, soggy microwaved pizza was delivered by the even more grumpy night receptionist who had obviously had to microwave it himself. For foodies that travel mainly in Asia, where nohting is too much trouble, any time of day or night we found this incredible for a hotel of this price range and standard.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay and Location”
Reviews.Author: Capt-Canuck5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3 night stay at the Villagio in late July. Loved being within walking distance to so many great restaurants and Yountville is a great town. Great pool and nice amenities. Loved the feel of the resort..it was like we were staying in our own condo in wine country!

Reviews.Title: “You will love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: icemanjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights and loved every minute of it. The service is 5 star, the location is the best in Napa valley in my opinion. The rooms are to die for. The price is somewhat high, but it's worth it for the occasional visit that you want to be a special memory. You will be staying directly across the street from some of the finest restaurants in the world) They are all just a very short walk from the hotel. There is a store and a post office across the street. And you will be in the heart of Napa Valley. All I can say is WOW. And we are not that easily impressed (at least we don't think we are)

Reviews.Title: “Great sample of Napa lifestyle, spacious property, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: zu23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night during the 4th of July weekend, very nice property and central location in Yountville. Walking distance to many wineries nearby like Jessup or Girard, and has on-property vineyard. Got upgraded to a suite, and while very spacious and nice the room was a bit older. Nice big tub with jacuzzi and nice extras like afternoon tea, breakfast buffet, and free bottle of wine in the room, but looks like the standard rack rate adds all this in. They did have a special during this time though luckily. Nice heated pool open 24 hours, and gym as well. Right across the street from Bistro Jeanty, and Bouchon. Seems generally kid friendly as there were plenty of other families with kids of all ages, and staff was very friendly. Had high expectations of the buffet as it was mentioned to be the best in the area, and while the omlet station was quite good, the rest of the selection was fair and what you'd expect from typical nice hotel breakfast - good but not outstanding. Outdoor walkway between rooms connected by nice garden / fountain stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Relax at the Villagio”
Reviews.Author: traveller92763
Reviews.Content: Husband's conference was held at the Villagio. What a beautiful place for a business gathering and a leisure trip. The staff was extremely helpful upon our early arrival and helped us with our business needs prior to our check in. Our room was huge! big comfy bed, sitting area, real fire place, dressing area, big tub. Welcome bottle of wine, and welcome cocktail in the lobby too. We had the hotel breakfast on our last morning, as the conference included meals, and it was very very good. Our meals were all catered by the hotel and they were wonderful. One of the meals was catered off site at the Tamber Bey Vineyard and it was spectacular. It is a charming spot, and you are right in a little village so there is shopping and dining. The spa is very nice. I booked a facial and I used the spa before hand. Really enjoyed it! Wonderful staff! The hotel is right near CA 29, and as other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms that border the highway have road noise. We were on that side, but I normally sleep with earplugs (learned that from traveling) and I slept just fine. I liked the location because it was easy to get to the wineries and vineyards. I liked the self parking - I like to be able to get to my car and go! The Villagio did a superb job of making the conference so intimate and special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Napa Valley on route to Lake Tahoe. We stopped at the visitor center in Napa Valley and they suggested we stay at the Villagio. What a great suggestion. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are wonderful. The moment we stepped in the the lobby we were treated like royalty. We were offered cocktails and the tea service was great. The room was large and the tub wonderful. Breakfast is a full breakfast with omlets, oatmeal, cereals, fruit and more. Anything we asked for was delivered in minutes and the staff will go above and beyond. Our room had a small patio which overlooked the vineyard which was great for sitting outside and reading. The room was extremely clean and the tub is hugh. You will not be disappointed at the Villagio.

Reviews.Title: “Waht a great spot for a getaway!”
Reviews.Author: JLCCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Wanted a quick gataway with my 28-year old daughter, and this certainly lived up to expectations. Staff was wonderful, room was ready early, tea in the lobby was more than I expected, and champagne full breakfast buffet was delicious. They have the details right here...bottled water in a tub as you leave the lobby. Bottle of wine in the room (along with a selecton for purchase), fireplace, and huge soaking tub. Casual elegance and beautiful grounds. The Spa is a great place to spend a couple of hours too, and you have access to the wonderful steam room, showers, outdoor hot tub, etc. even if you don't book a treatment. And all of this is included in the room price! I will be back. Thay nailed it!

Reviews.Title: “superb all the way down to the details”
Reviews.Author: sohejo
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful property in the epicenter of America's fine food and wine capital. Architecturally stunning with lush foliage and wonderful fountains along its pathways. The staff is fantastic, Keith who helped us at the front desk was great and obviously well trained, I love the fact that they have bottled water on ice as you walk into the front door, if you've been wine tasting that is exactly what you need by the time you get back to your hotel. Our room was sooo comfortable with a deep soaking-jacuzzi style tub, fireplace, balcony and four post bed.... very romantic. Then there is the pool and spa, unreal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service - Saved our Trip! Only place to stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: APeloquin
Reviews.Content: When planning a trip to Napa, there is no other town I'd stay in other than Yountville, and there's no other property family I'd stay with than the Villagio/Vintage Inn. I was planning a surprise trip to Napa for Memorial Day weekend, and came into some complications with our itinerary. Thankfully, the great people at Villagio/Vintage Inn came to our rescue. The Managing Director and his entire team were invaluable to help plan our trip and offered up suggestions. This hotel property and the Vintage Inn have been in Yountville for years, and it is no wonder why they have maintained such a strong reputation for so long. We are absolutely excited for our trip and can't wait to come. In this day and age with hotels, it's great to see such care and concern emanating from a hotel property's management. I would trust these folks with any trip! Stay here- you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and spa in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: LGP6868
Reviews.Content: We will definitely return to Villagio. First, the location is perfect. You are within a very short walking distance of several of the best restaurants in the wine country. Redd and Ad Hoc are across the street, and French Laundry, Bistro Jeanty and Bottego are within a block. You are also surrounded by charming tasting rooms and shops. The hotel is beautiful, quiet, and elegant. The staff is attentive. The room includes a complimentary breakfast, which is a huge spread with an omelet station, and also includes items such as a delicious quiche, chiliquilies, pastries, hot oatmeal. Our suite was lovely with a fireplace, balcony, and huge whirlpool tub.

Reviews.Title: “Villagio is showing it's age!”
Reviews.Author: Coal_Harbour
Reviews.Content: You pay top dollar to stay there and it's tough to justify their prices. The rooms are dated and somewhat run down. The grounds are nice but the overall upkeep isn't what it used to be. For example all of the flowers onr balcony were dead or almost dead. The ponds needed cleaning and so on. If you like Yountville look at some of the other options like Bardessono [sic], Hotel Luca, Yountville Inn. We've stayed at all of them and they are better kept and offer better value than Villagio does.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulousl Place to Relax and Enjoy Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: MauiFreshChef
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing place. I did some research and for my needs this place met them all and more. From the warm creamy hot chocolate upon check-in, to the bottle of wine in the room, to the luxurious bathroom and the afternoon tea with homemade pastries and fig jam (TO DIE FOR!). The staff and particularly concierge Mary were outstanding. And the free use of the spa: Vichy Showers, Steam Room, Sauna, Relaxation Room and Outdoor Hot Tub with Fireplace! Does it get better? And they change the drinks daily (pomegranate water or cucumber melon or cranberry lime). You can get massages and other treatments on request. There was free yoga and free use of the gym. The morning breakfast was delicious, fresh and plentiful. The bread pudding gets high marks as does the variety and selection! AMAZING PLACE in NAPA VALLEY! A MUST VISIT!

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: doctormdj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a last minute trip to Napa and found a $199 rate. The place is simply amazing. The is no better place to stay than this one. If you want to be close to all the winerys and the best restaurants, this hotel rocks. The people were kind and very easy to work with. Honestly, I have nothing bad to say at all. One of the best things is the breakfast. The chef makes a full buffett breakfast which is included in any room you get. Just find the cheapest room and the breakfast is included... even if they say it's not. It;s not just a piece of toast either. It's a full spread with an omlette bar. Truly amazing. we are coming back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: stanford360
Reviews.Content: Warm friendly place. Staff is very helpful with kids and recommendations for things to do in the area. Great spa and setting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot, great location, very nice spa”
Reviews.Author: SCCalifornia
Reviews.Content: we got a fantastic rate $159! of course it is rainy cold March, and a weekday....but the perfect spot for a girlfriends get away or couples retreat. the grounds are lovely. the lobbey is warm and welcoming, with a large fireplace and lots of cozy seating. beautiful patio and pool. breakfast is included and it is outstanding - huge selection of delicious and very fresh pastries, bagels, oatmeal, delicious breakfast burritos, potatoes, cheese, made to order omlets, fruit, juices, champagne - you name it!!! wish we would have been back from the wineries in time to check out the afternoon reception. Rooms are very nice, though not quite as luxorious as the rest of the resort. There is a lovely pation off each room, and they give you a bottle of wine! A bit dark, but with fireplace. Mattresses was OK, not bad, but not top notch. It is firm, which I like, and I am pretty picky. Sheets are good. Had 2 for 1 treatsment special at the Spa which were wonderful! Can walk to many of the fabulous restaurants nearby. Bottege was outstanding!!! I would definately come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Group Celebration”
Reviews.Author: BoBo082608
Reviews.Content: my husband & i joined friends to celebrate a special birthday. the entire party of 11 stayed at the hotel, and everyone agreed that it was a fine place to stay. it is well-located - a quick walk to the main area of Yountville with shops and restaurants. it has a fantastic main lobby with an equally great tea service/buffet and champagne breakfast - a great bonus for families and groups. our particular room was large with a great fireplace ... if somewhat impersonal. friends had much smaller rooms (not sure why) and one complained about street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Venue”
Reviews.Author: jayne2164
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, very big with huge jacuzzi bath and a real log fire. This was needed as the weather was unseasonally cold. Yountville is a good location for wine tasting around the Napa Valley region and the advantage of staying at the Villagio is that there are lots of very good restaurants in walking distance (5-10 mins max) of the hotel. Downside was the lack of bars particularly as the hotel bar closed at 10pm which seemed a bit early. Didnt have time to use the Spa or pool but collegues tell me both were very good. The conferencing facility was very good and we were looked after very well. Excellent lunches and almost too much in the way of snacks and drinks throughout the day. Again the meeting room had a huge fireplace and the staff were happy to light the fire for us when it was cold. Would go again but ask for a room away from the rear of the hotel as there was a lot of traffic noise from the main road to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great spa, great location, great breakfast but hotel could be better”
Reviews.Author: joanne7575
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days post-Christmas and enjoyed it very much. The spa is fantastic and the people at the hotel are all very friendly. Breakfast is wonderful and part of the price. The only negative is that the rooms are quite dated, dark with road noise. The bathroom in particular was dark and dingy with poor water pressure. One outstanding touch was the duralog to use in the fireplace. Also the complimentary bottle of wine was very nice. You couldn't fault the location, walkable to all the good restaurants in Yountville. I would stay here again but, considering their prices, the rooms could be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Thanksgiving Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ocErica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Thanksgiving 2009 in Napa Valley. We chose to stay in Yountville because of its central location and the amazing restaurants. We could not have been happier with our decision to stay there and specifically with the hotel we chose, the Villagio Inn & Spa. We got a great deal ($225 a night) and stayed for 2 nights, but wish we could have stayed longer. I understand this price is much lower than their average price, so we got an exceptional value. The breakfast alone is worth it. Complimentary coffee, mimosas, bloody marys and a wonderful spread of breads, fruit, cereral, eggs, and the most amazing bread pudding ever! They also have a made to order omelette and waffle station. We arrived early on Thanksgiving Day (about 11 am) and were able to check-in and enjoy an early lunch (the breakfast buffet is available until noon on holidays). This was perfect as most restaurants weren't open and our dinner reservation was not until 7:15 PM. We sat out on the patio in the beautiful autumn sunshine, surrounded by the vibrant fall colors of the trees of Yountville and enjoyed our first tastes of their delicous food and drink (all included in the price of the room!) Our room was spacious and clean. The amenities were nice and even included a Nespresso machine. Yum! My only complaint was there was a little bit of road noice from Highway 29 because our room was on the outer courtyard. The spa looked very nice, although we didn't have a chance to use it. We did sit in the hot tub one evening and the pool area was nice. It would be fun to stay here in the summer too! All of the greast Yountville restaurants are within walking distance as well as some cute shops. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Napanut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to Napa for over ten years. We always stay in different places to experience something new. The Villagio is usually very expensive and staying in yountville at a previous hotel showed us that the town is the center of wine country. We were able to get a bargain rate for this hotel and lets just say, they delivered...it is everything I expected. No its not the four season but the service, breakfast rooms and concierge were great. OUr flilght from Chicago was delayed so badly we did not arrive until 4 am. The gentleman at the front desk when we checked in was so nice, he prepared tea and sandwiches for us as we mentioned we did not have dinner on our 5 hour flight. We didn't ask he just brought the meal up with our bags. The best thing was he didn't even charge us for the food as that was on the room service menu. THe concierge Mary was also fantastic. The rooms were very big, the bathroom was nice, the balcony was very nice. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Autumnal Splendor”
Reviews.Author: kmkChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful and very friendly. Room lovely - in room coffee terrific. Great pool and hot tub. Fountains throughout the grounds are soothing and pretty. Great massage. Super free brunch in the a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not five star”
Reviews.Author: travelingtchr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villagio because everywhere else was full. When we checked in the desk was busy. The woman at the desk was helping the people who arrived before us, but the gentleman at the desk ignored me, futzing with papers. I am not sure why. He avoided making eye contact with me and I waited until the other person could help me. My husband was more upset about it than I was. The public areas are very pretty and they had someone playing piano in the front room during wine and cheese time, which was a plus. The grounds and gardens are very well kept and the rooms are large, well supplied and relatively soundproof. We had an upstairs room which I liked because then we didn't have to listen to people stomping over our heads. The room was well appointed, good mattress and linens, lots of lighting, wine glasses and glasses etc. The complimentary bottle of wine was not something I would drink but a gesture nonetheless. Our breakfast was on the patio in the morning and it was very good. Seasonal fruit, muffins, biscuits, bread, omlettes and waffles made to order, and the service was friendly but unobtrusive. It does get crowded out there so I advise anyone who likes to have a quiet breakfast to go early. There was no newspaper visable, which we missed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, great breakfast, no vineyard views”
Reviews.Author: bstcal
Reviews.Content: Villagio Inn is a very nice, well-kept property. PROS: comfortable, luxurious, very good buffet breakfast, good size rooms, helpful staff, and centrally located right off Hwy 29. CONS: You are in wine country but you can't see a vine from any room in the property. If your blinds are open, there is no privacy. Every window in their rooms either faces a walkway (courtyard) or parking lot, so if you like to sit in your room, reading, sipping wine, etc and would like the daylight coming in, this is not the hotel for you. Stay here: if you want a centrally located hotel to wine-tasting, walking distance to good restaurants and you don't plan on spending time in your room. Dont stay here if you like to read a book while enjoying napa valley views on a patio. Two other notes: The spa was very nice, but can't say it is worth what they are charging. Also, the downstairs rooms can hear foot traffic from the upstairs rooms. Ask to be upstairs if you are a light sleeper or if footsteps on your head will bother you.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful grounds, immaculate spacious and clean rooms, and really nice bathrooms. Loved the bath products too! Would definitely stay here again if I am back in Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice ammenities, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerinTX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Yountville in March 2009 and chose to stay at the Villagio. It was our first trip to Napa Valley, we were staying just one night as we spent the weekend in San Fransisco with friends. We got an off-season special, and from the looks of the 'average price' on here I think our room was somewhere around 60%+ off (we paid ~$200/night). We really enjoyed our experience at the Villagio. We were given a ground floor room that was very large, the bathroom was huge and the fireplace was a very nice touch. The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed sitting on the patio, even though it faced another room (we were there in off season so it wasn't exactly packed). It was too cold to use the pool but the setup looked great. Wish we had gotten a chance to use the hot tub! Breakfast was superb, one of the best 'complimentary' breakfasts i have ever had, anywhere in the world! The hotel is perfectly situated in Yountville, which is a very nice option for anyone who is making a first trip to Napa...very central. Just hit 29N and you can't miss all the wineries! My husband and I really loved the Cakebread winery. Also Chandon is beautiful and the tour is quite nice, also they have a little patio where you can partake of a sparkling beverage and order food, mixed drinks, etc....a great place to spend your lunch or get a late afternoon snack! In summation...we really enjoyed our stay...keep in mind though we didn't pay $400+ to stay, i'm not sure it would live up to other $400 hotels I've stayed at, but it competed nicely in the price range we paid!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: tylertx
Reviews.Content: We chose the Villagio because of it's location. We will go back because of the great breakfast, staff, accomodations and location. We travelled with another couple to celebrate wedding anniversaries, we scheduled vineyard tours everyday and the location paid off. There is a great 2 mile walking loop that the front desk staff told us about. You are within walking distance to several great restaurants. I would highly recommend the Villagio. Be sure to check on line for special rates!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: SugarNOLA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week and were very impressed. I booked through hotels.com in an exterior room. When we checked in, we were upgraded to an interior room. They even let us choose which one we would rather. We also had friends staying there and they had an exterior room. They said they did not hear any road noise. The champagne breakfast is fabulous- chef making omelets to order. You can sit out by the pool and enjoy the wonderful breakfast. Many other selections as well. A chilled bottle of wine awaits you in your room. I loved the big dressing/bathroom area with dual sinks. We were very comfortable here and would definitely recommend and stay here again. The staff could not have been nicer and we hated to leave. Also, it is very convenient to many restaurants and Highway 29 is just down the road to head to all of the wineries. We had a fabulous trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Christina_Severin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in the Napa Wine Country and chose the Villagio Inn and Spa for our hotel accomodations. The location was conveniently located near Highway 29 (where the majority of wineries are located). It was a great place to come back to after a day of wine tasting. It's also located within walking distance of some wonderful restaurants including Bottega where we enjoyed a night of fine dining that was conservatively priced. The turn down service was a nice touch along with the champagne breakfast served every morning between 7-10am. For those that enjoy a midnight dip in the pool, the pool is open 24 hours! Our room was located downstairs and you could hear some traffic from Highway 29. However, it was definitely not a deal breaker!

Reviews.Title: “MUCH more than expected”
Reviews.Author: keirao
Reviews.Content: WOW! First of all, having read some of the "ok" reviews about this hotel, I was a little bit skeptical that my stay was going to be as great as I expected. I was WRONG. I would go back in a heartbeat. First of all Frankie was working the front desk and answered a million and one questions about everything. He was wonderful. Concierge helped us book a wine tour and sensed we kind of wanted something on a budget and really got us a great deal, with complimentary passes to wine tastings. Breakfast every morning was not your typical "breakfast included" There was an omelette station, fresh fruit, potatoes, oatmeal, cheese, etc. Pool area was small but VERY quiet. Definitely not a hotel for screaming kids. Rooms were spacious with a balcony, and a complimentary wine for check in. We are not big fans of Chardonnay and asked front desk if we could have a Sauvignon Blanc or Pino Grigio and they happily obliged. Each afternoon I got a salad with grilled chicken and the chicken was fresh and tasty. Complimentary wine tasting on Thursday was disappointing, but that was only because we didn't care for the wines. The hotel is in walking distance to all the restaurants, which was nice. Great views of ballooning if you are up at 6am. Beautifully landscaped. Friendly and helpful staff. The pool waitress even brought my friend and I cleaning cloths for our sunglasses! Complimentary Evian water as needed. Overall, although I traveled with my friend, I would HIGHLY recommend for spouse/significant other. It's very romantic! Although we didn't try, both fitness and spa facilities were complimentary to guests (not treatments) and the pool is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “The Center of Yountville”
Reviews.Author: Crash89
Reviews.Content: The reception was friendly but a little busy which can mean that they are a good hotel and are taking care of everything or that they are a hotel that has no clue what's going on. For this stay I would say that they are a good place. The room was dark, that's my over all memory of the space. Even as the door to the terrace was wide open and the blinds were opened the room was dark, strange. Anyway besides my curiosity regarding the natural lighting issue the room was a good size including a sitting area, a separate bathroom from the duel sinks and dressing area. The king sized, four pot bed was very comfortable and had some sexy lighting above it and a fire place near by. The room's amenities were good, n espresso machine, a complimentary bottle of wine, a large flat screen TV that turns on to a relaxing program of classical music and a slide show of impressionist art. The grounds of the complex are delightful with various fountains decorating the outdoor paths. A pool is available as is the spa. Ahhh, the spa! I took advantage of the guest services including, a killer, million nozzle shower that will clean you like you've never been cleaned, a sauna, a eucalyptus steam room which the attendant recommended for hangovers, an outdoor hot tub, a sitting room complete with magazines and television. These facilities are not coed but each gender has the same outlets. The spa is very pleasant and a place to look forward to visiting if you're staying here. The Villagio Inn also is kind enough to include a complimentary breakfast which unfortunately I did not make it to. I have to say that that this estableshment is the type of place I could return to again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit: Even Better than in 2005.”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTraveler9
Reviews.Content: We had a brief time to meet a couple that go back very far with us and chose one night at Villagio in Napa. For the Monday night we found a discounted stay on their web site, well under our previous stop. But we found the Villagio even better than we remembered from a longer visit four years ago. The superbly kept gardens were worth the entire stay. Plantings now much better screen out the too close highway. Staff from arrival to departure were polite and helpful and the morning breakfast is just superb, much improved over the good standard we enjoyed before. We found the rooms big, clean and equipped as requested with suitable handicapped facilities. We look forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - little extras are nice!”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelcrazy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business and the grounds are nice and the room was large and well done. My room had a fireplace and big bathroom. Also, there was a complimentary bottle of wine waiting in the room and also a selection of wines (along with descriptions) available to purchase in a wine cabinet in the room. There is a coffee maker and espresso maker in the room. The pool area and grounds are also great. Want to come back for a weekend with friends soon.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Love to Travel 50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villagio April 3-7 and absolutely loved it. The grounds are gorgeous and immaculate. The room was huge and very nice. The Inn is very small so you are very close to everything. It is a very romantic place to stay. You are just across the street from the shops and hotels. Everything is walking distance. I would definitely return. It is fairly pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay All Around”
Reviews.Author: Beaudoin001
Reviews.Content: My wife took us here for my 40th birthday. The rooms were pleasant and the grounds nice. We had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous champagne breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: geezerhippie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villagio for two nights in Jan. to celebrate my 60th birthday. Our room was very nice. We enjoyed the jaquzzi surrounded by candles while sipping on our complimentary bottle of champagne, then enjoyed the fireplace before going to Mustards for dinner. If you stay here request a room not on the highway side. Our room was on the "town side" and was nice and quiet. The location is a perfect homebase for visiting the hundreds of wineries in the Napa Valley. The soaps and shampoos were divine, and the bathroom was huge. The little town of Yountville is small, quiet, and stressfree. The best part of our stay was the delicious breakfast buffet . A cook is outside in the beautiful courtyard area making omelettes, and inside are homemade pastries, cakes, quiches, and other yummy finger foods. The coffee is delicious, and champagne is included. We will stay here again if we go back. You can't beat all that you get for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: Minibarmuncher
Reviews.Content: We love Yountville and stayed one night at Villagio. While we had a great trip (Bottega dinner was top notch!) the stay was just OK as it didn't live up to our expectations... the whole place feels like an Orange County condo complex from the late '80's with cheesey columns and faux Italian fountains and things feeling a little run-down. (We stayed in a downstairs room) Cons: -Room has dated look -Bed sagged in middle (we both awoke with sore lower backs) -Bed sheets not that nice -Room was dark and looked out into another room...not sure if upstairs rooms have views, but downstairs ones def. do not. -In-the-wall air conditioning unit -General grounds feel dated -Can hear highway from the pool Pros: -Service quite friendly (glass of wine at check-in nice touch) -Very nice, new big spa facility (we walked around it, but didn't use it) -Pool area is a bit of a scene (pro and a con, depending what you are looking for) -Complimentary breakfast is a good spread I think we will try another Yountville hotel on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villagio due to it's proximity to the French Laundry. Based on the previous reviews I feel that we may have missed something great about this hotel? The location is right off highway 29 in the beautiful town of Yountville and a perfect spot to enjoy the wine country. The hotel is nice, just did not find it very special. The front desk staff were friendly however when we parked I felt that I was going through the motions at a mid-priced property, self park, walking through parking lot and back of hotel to get to our room? Perhaps a valet option (is there one? If so it was not offered), someone to escort us to our room? The guestroom were large and great to have the fireplace. Bed linens however were worn and had holes in them. Breakfast was a bit of a free for all, not many staff available to clear tables, replenish buffet, limited seating. Staff in general are somewhat too below the radar for my liking, friendly not attentive. Overall, not bad, just not in a hurry to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: joco18
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is right in Yountville, on the same block as the top restaurants. My wife really enjoyed a massage at the spa which was being renovated at the time, but now is probably finished and beautiful. The staff was very friendly and helpful in assisting us as we got lost drive from San Francisco. The breakfast was lovely and we would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: zelzah
Reviews.Content: The Villagio is very nice. The rooms are big and clean, the breakfast is good and a perfect start to the day, and the pool is clean and comfortable. The spa is also very nice, and my wife found it to be first rate. The service is pleasant enough, but it's a bit underwhelming; not a lot of attempts are made to go out of their way to cater to your needs. We're very low maintenance, and so we didn't demand a lot, but I might have been upset if I was someone who was accustom to first-rate service, or if I had paid top dollar for the room (I didn't-- it was off-season and the room was very reasonable). No one offered to take my bags up to the room, concierge couldn't get me a reservation at a hot restaurant (I walked in and was seated immediately)--little things that you might expect. Overall, it's a relaxed, sprawling hotel centrally located to everything you need. If you want quaint or top-notch service, it's not the hotel for you. However, if you want clean, centrally located to all roads and easy access to some great restaurants, I'd highly recommend the Villagio.

Reviews.Title: “Total Comfort”
Reviews.Author: mrdduck
Reviews.Content: Sadly, we stayed just one night at the Villagio. The room was very large. There was a small refrigerator, coffee and expresso makers, internet access, comfy pillow-top mattress, lots of storage, a little patio with table and chairs- everything needed for a completely relaxing stay. The breakfast was extensive and excellent. (I would recommend requesting a 2nd floor room. We had a ground floor corner room and had to keep the blinds closed.) The spa was lovely. The staff was efficient and friendly - never stuffy or snooty. The hotel is an easy walk to any of the fabulous Yountville restaurants. Overall, the Villagio is absolutely first class.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay!”
Reviews.Author: bako1022
Reviews.Content: This was our first overnight visit to Napa, as we usually stay in Sonoma. We were so happy with the Villagio. We stayed in an upper level, inner courtyard King, with a lovely view. Our room was beautiful. Breakfast was outstanding. We never made it back from visiting the nearby wineries for the afternoon tea...maybe next time, as we have just booked a return trip for September!

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Disappointment of our Winery Trip”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl11851
Reviews.Content: With all of the hotels in the Napa area I struggled to make a choice. Since my daughter and I were interested in having one destination where we could have spa services, and based on many TripAdvisor reviews, we chose the Villagio. After making the reservation I called on 3 different occassions and left messages for someone to call me back so that I could make the spa appointments and dinner reservations but no one ever did. Finally I called a fourth time and reached a spa representative. Since the spa is open until 8 I wanted appointments around 5 -5:30. I was told that 4 and 4:30 were the latest appointments available. The woman I spoke to was most unpleasant and when I tried to inquire if perhaps different types of treatments were available later in the day I was told that the spa does not offer any services past 4:30. Since the person who took the room reservation had assured me I could make spa appointments up until 7:00 I was confused but obviously not getting anywhere with the person I was speaking to. I settled on the 4 and 4:30 treatments. When my daughter and I checked into the hotel I confirmed the appointments. Prior to setting out to visit the local wineries we stopped at the concierge desk to inquire about wineries to visit. We were given a few complimentary passes but no knowledgeable information or suggestions on where to go. We rushed back from the wineries for our scheduled spa appointments. My daughter was seen at 4 and I waited in the ladies lounge for my 4:30 appointment. At 4:45 I went out to the desk to inquire where the therapist was but the receptionist was not there. At 5pm I returned to the desk again where 2 young women were chatting and laughing. I inquired about my treatment and their response was that they did not remember I was there or know where the therapist was. They said they would call the manager who did speak to me on the phone. He assured me that I would not have to pay for my treatment that I had not received and offerred me a gift certificate for my next spa visit. I told him I was from NY and not planning on returning. I told him I wanted my daughter's treatment to be complimentary which he agreed to. He also said the general manager of the hotel would contact me to offer me additional compensation but she has never called me. Upon checkout the charges for both spa treatments were still on my bill and it took approximately 30 minutes and many phone calls to have the spa charges removed. I do not expect this type of service from a hotel of this caliber. The physical hotel was nice and the fireplace in the room was a great touch. But the negatives certainly outweigh the positives at the Villagio.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Better every year”
Reviews.Author: mikaso
Reviews.Content: We visit the area at least once every year and for the last six years have chosen The Villagio. This hotel, which should better be described as a SPA, is beyond excellent. The rooms are outstanding and very confortable. The in room fireplace provides a very relaxing atmosphere. The staff is friendly and you have to consult Mary DuVoure, the concierge, and follow her excellent recomendations. Itl is located right across the street from four of the best restaurants in the area. For an excellent dinner you do not have to drive out which is a good idea when you consider enjoying the liquified fruits of the valley. We have to fly more than nine hours to get here and it is worth every minute. We are two million milers which makes us close to experts on hotel accomodations. With that said, do we recommend The Villagio? YES!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: karavalley
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last August and I was so impressed with the resort. Yes, the rooms could use some remodeling but we rarely in our comfortable and well appointed room. We had a fireplace and we did use it one night (chilly napa nights). The daily morning champagne buffet spread is one of the nicest I've experienced. The pool is lovely and we enjoyed ourselves lounging every afternoon after a tiring day visiting the wineries. The spa was brand new and we liked our massages. I recommend this resort to all my friends. If you are a foodie - try the restaurant "Red" across the street - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel its like something in a book”
Reviews.Author: maclers
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience service was good the rooms do need a bit of a doing up but its not bad at all rooms are huge and very private, breakfast is brillant but the coffee was [--] everything else was brillant. stay ther for a nice after visiting San francisco on a trip to the Napa to dine in French Laundry accross the road, If you do stay in the hotel be sure to wander around this beautiful village, the hotel is pricey but worth it

Reviews.Title: “Best Thanksgiving ever at Villagio Inn and Spa”
Reviews.Author: murberg
Reviews.Content: Villagio Inn and Spa in Yountville, CA November 27-30, 2008 Just returned from a glorious Thanksgiving weekend in Napa wine country. We stayed at the Villagio Inn and Spa and although we have stayed there in the past, we were pleasantly surprised to see all of the new upgrades including the new spa. The rooms were completely updated from our last visit two years ago and the staff was as pleasant and helpful as we remembered. The gratis breakfast buffet has always been a hit, but the addition of an omelet station on the patio is a nice touch. We stayed in an upstairs room that was well appointed and extremely comfortable after a day of wine tasting, but as nice as the room was, the spa was the main attraction as far as me and my wife were concerned. It is definitely state of the art and a substantial improvement over the former spa which is now used for private parties. Our treatments were the best we have ever had as they have very private spa suites which made for a unique experience. The suite has private steam/showers, whirlpool tubs, fireplaces and balconies. The staff was attentive to our every needs and plied us with food and beverages as part of the package. The location of the inn is perfect as there are no fewer than 10 restaurants within walking distance including the world class French Laundry and a short drive to many wineries. Can't wait until next year for a return engagement!!

Reviews.Title: “Wine country's perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: khanks70471
Reviews.Content: We were there for nearly a week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This is a very relaxing atmosphere with a very couteous, unobtrusive staff. The morning breakfast was exceptional in both variety and quality. This was our second stay here and it won't be my last. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Hotel in Yountivlle”
Reviews.Author: brooksz
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positives. The staff is really efficient in a low-key way. They smile when they greet you and really aim to please. The champagne breakfast is a lovely affair with made to order waffles, eggs, etc. The never ending supply of fruits and cheeses made it a great breakfast for both my husband and me. Sorry to say we never made it back to the hotel to enjoy afternoon tea but I am sure it was a relaxing way to spend some time. The Molton Brown toiletries were smashing as well! Unfortunately the rest of the resort was a huge disappointment. I don't know which rooms other reviewers stayed in but I suggest avoiding room 225. The room has a view of the paring lot and not much else, a mattress that feels like it has been in the room since the hotel opened. stained or badly painted bathroom ceiling (not sure which but it is a dirty brown color) and a mish-mash of furnishing. The bed coverings had also seen a lot of use. And unfortunately one hears ALL the noise from the road and the adjoining room! We usually stay at The Vintage Inn just down the road. It is ever so slightly more intimate, the noise level is substantially less and it too has the great breakfast/afternoon teas. The decor is a lot less "tired" and the staff is equally accommodating. The two properties are run by the same firm (who now also run the catalog company called NapaStyle)so the differences in accommodations are surprising. Hopefully the hotel is working on a redecoration of the hotel otherwise I fear that there will not be many more positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “great stay but to short”
Reviews.Author: mdr9
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Napa. We only stayed at the hotel one night because we stayed in Sonoma the rest of the time. Big mistake because I didnt want to leave this hotel. The spa was great and you cant start of the day better that with the champagne breakfast. All in all this hotel was great and we will stay hear again when we come back. The only thing I can see people having a problem with is it worth the price. We stayed during the week so it was half the price, great value for the room and service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: desiresunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villagio for one night and really enjoyed our stay. The room was large and included a bottle of wine. Although we didn't use the fireplace, we had one which was a nice addition. They include an evening reception with snacks and a wonderful breakfast in the morning. We sat by the pool and took a walk which were both relaxing. We would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to stay in Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: runandbehappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Valligio Inn through Napa Valley Bike Tours. This was a wonderful place to stay, and we are thankful that they booked it for us. When we first arrived, we received an complimentary Bellini in the lobby, and then once we arrived in our room there was a comp. bottle of Beringer's Chardonnay as well. I said to the bellman as he was leaving, "Are all the rooms this nice?" and his response was, "Yeah, yeah there are." The room was so roomy, comfortable, and perfect. The bed had a feather bed, very nice sheets, and perfect pillows. There was a great balcony to look out over the vineyards, see the sunset or rise, and in the mornings, we got to see the hot air ballons take off. The buffet breakfast served each morning was fantastic. They had made to order omelets, and always something different each day (ex. heuvos rancheros, breakfast burritos) in addition to the daily servings of nice cheeses, fruit, bagels, oatmeal, break pudding, fresh juices, and mimosas. We had a spa treatment each day in the newly renovated spa. What a slice of heaven! Be sure to get there early so you can enjoy the whole experience! All in all, my husband and I had the best time at the Vallagio Inn. We would definitely return to stay there. There is nothing bad I can say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Restful weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: JLK2008
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Villagio and would recommend it to anyone visiting the Napa valley wineries. The morning breakfast buffet is fabulous, includes both hot and cold offerings and was much enjoyed by us both. The rooms are charming, comfortable and spacious and decorated in a way that feels like home away from home. The Villagio also has a central location in Yountville and is within a short walking distance to terrific restaurants such as Bouchon and Bistro Jeanty. Loved our stay there and hope to back one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: pandabear88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a small New Year's trip with my boyfriend a few years back and it was unforgettable. I got a massage and a mud wrap and practically fell asleep because it was so soothing. The room was huge and we had our own private balcony. The bathroom also and a jacuzzi. We didn't go swimming because it was raining really hard. All in all, I had a great time. The breakfast buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Villagio is a Good Option in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: cac258
Reviews.Content: The Villagio Inn and Spa is an upscale hotel in Yountville. The location is ideal, and Yountville is one of the best places to stay in Napa. The room was nice, a few nice touches (complimentary bottle of wine waiting for us, nice Nexpresso espresso machine, plenty of bottled water, etc.). The room was also nice size, and had a fireplace. The pool and hot tub were nice, the pool was heated and was nice and warm. The Champagne breakfast (included with room) was very good, worth about $20 per person I'd say. We walked through the new spa, looks very nice (didn't use it though). The location is great, you are directly across the street from Bistro Jeanty (was great) and is a SHORT walk to Bouchon, Redd, Ad Hoc, French Laundry, etc. The quantity of great restaurants you can go to without getting into your car is astounding. There is also a nice little shopping area right next to the hotel with some nice shops. Yountvillie is very close to many of the popular wineries, it is no more than about 30 minutes to 80 or 90% of the wineries. The only real problem we had at Villagio (and what got it my rating of 4 instead of 5) is that we didn't have hot water one morning and could not shower. This was pretty frustrating at such an upscale resort (some breaker got flipped or something like that). The good news is when I complained at check out they were very accommodating and took a nice amount of money off my bill, so I felt that they definitely made amends. Over all, Villagio is one of the nicer places to stay in all of wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet retreat in the heart of wine country”
Reviews.Author: billiverstravels
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with a word re other recent reviews: There is no longer any construction at this hotel. In fact, I have seldom stayed in a quieter hotel. We had two adjoining rooms: a pleasant suite and a normal room. Both were well appointed, clean, and no smell of smoke anywhere, including the towels. (My pet peeve is a smoky hotel towel.) The check-in was pleasant and efficient. We were led to the room by a very nice staff member, possibly because the layout of the buildings calls for this when you first arrive. The layout is a series of two-story buildings, mostly, in my view, 2 rooms up and 2 rooms down. There is a slight Tuscan feel to the place. It has immaculately manicured grounds with lush vegetation and water features separating the buildings. The size of the suite is possibly a little small for the price, but you will get a separate seating room, which, by the way, seemed fairly useless unless you want your children to have a separate little play area. There is a pleasant but tiny patio, a nice size closet and a fine bathroom. The size of the normal room was fine and it had the same size (tiny) patio where you could sit and read or enjoy the lemon trees just outside. The rooms are rather dark in the daytime, but that helps with feeling cooler on a hot day. But you won't want to spend a lot of daytime hours in your room while in Napa Valley, I hope! Beds were very comfortable, bathtubs were new in appearance, and the room furnishings were fine. There was a normal-sized flat screen TV on the wall opposite the beds in each room. Nothing was rundown in any way. The pool was perfectly pleasant, if small, with beautiful landscaping around it. Breakfast highlights: an accomplished omelet chef and beautifully ripe fruit. Everything was fresh, even towards the end of the breakfast period when we were there. There was a much better selection of foods besides the usual breakfast fare. Kudos for them having hot oatmeal... such a healthy choice. The location, in Yountville in central Napa Valley, cannot be beat for convenience. It is within walking distance of L'Etoile at Domaine Chandon, and there is, we were told, two great little restaurants across the street. There is, however, no view from most of the rooms. Women with whom we were traveling enjoyed the spa. All in all, this is a very pleasant little hotel I would revisit. One piece of advise: When you request a wake up call, be sure they have your room number. Phone back and double check your wake up call. Better yet, always take your own travel-size alarm clock. I forgot mine and - Murphys Law - two different hotels on this trip missed my wake up calls!

Reviews.Title: “Losing a little luster”
Reviews.Author: travelvixen9
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 nights at the Villagio for a mid-week getaway. This is our 3rd visit to the Villagio in the last 7 years, and unfortunately, it seems to be showing it's age. Rooms seem a little worn, and down-at-the-heels. Bathrooms are sparsely decorated with only a few amenities, bathrobes are clean but have been over-laundered. Carpeting and paint need updating. I got a good rate (February, mid-week, so not high season) of $195/night, but had I been paying peak rates, I would have been sorely disappointed. This being said, king beds were very comfortable, the in-room wine cellar had a nice selection of little-known wines, hotel staff is very helpful and courteous. Gym facilities are off-site, at a community fitness center, so be prepared to wait for a treadmill or a bike. Breakfast is included and is a very nice spread. Try the bread pudding!! Outstanding. Overall, not a bad place, but compared to my first two visits, has declined a bit. Definitely not luxury accommodation, but an acceptable place to put your head.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in Napa”
Reviews.Author: sjtenem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Villagio for our anniversary in October. We have stayed at many 'boutique' hotels as well as high end hotels and this hotel was neither. It is basically a glorified motel off the highway. I had heard that the hotel was under construction and called the hotel a few weeks prior to our arrival to request a room away from the construction. They said my request would be accommodated upon arrival. When we arrived at the hotel, they told us that despite our request, the only rooms they had available were actually near the construction. We didn't get any sort of apology from the manager and we got zero acknowledgment that it was our anniversary (even though when I booked it, I let them know. Unlike our stay in the Hotel Vitale in San Francisco where upon arrival we were greeted with cards, flowers, and champagne for our anniversary). Our room was definitely spacious and had nice smelling molton brown products, but the room was far from clean. There were ants in the room and the furniture & paint was run down. The "Champagne Brunch" was terrible - stale bagels, bread, hard cheeses, powdered eggs and over done sausage. We did take advantage of the pool area which was actually well kept. The hot tub was nice and we reclined on the big couch like lounge chairs. On our second day at the Villagio, we received a message on our phone saying we had an "amenity at the front desk". Any hotel we've ever stayed at has always had the amenity waiting in our room when we arrived (such as complimentary bottle of champagne). We called the front desk and asked if the amenity could be delivered to our room but they insisted we must go pick it up. We were leaving on a plane so at that point we had no need for whatever it was they were going to offer us. Luckily, we were there in Yountville to tour the amazing wineries in Napa so we didn't spend too much time in our room. The only advantage to staying at the Villagio was that it was walking distance to some of the best restaurants. We ate at Bouchon which was amazing. I would also recommend Auberge du Soleil for dinner (ate the best Risotto ever there). All in all, our stay at the Villagio was mediocre and we were very disappointed with the facilities. But, we loved Napa and the town of Yountville so we had a terrific time regardless of our experience at the Villagio.

Reviews.Title: “My Napa Experience”
Reviews.Author: shibumi29
Reviews.Content: Our weekend trip to Napa. Just few days to get away before the crazy holiday season. The hotel entrance and lobby was very nice. The room we had was on the upper floor which was quite large. The dressing area and the bathroom was very nice with 2 vanity and a very large bathtub. The dimmer lights in the bath area is definitely a nice touch. The problem we has was the bed. Terrible mattress, super lumpy even with a down mattress cover. The coverlet was very heavy and uncomfortable. Unfortunately the room did not have central heating with thermostat. For a very nice hotel, we thought that the heating system was very motel like. We constantly had to turn on and turn off the heat to keep our room temperature even. One thing nice was the champagne breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mollelliott
Reviews.Content: don't order room service. Good to the breakfast provided. Very ice grounds and rooms. Perfect location for leaving the hotel and going to great dining or launching to the wineries. Spa could be nicer but the quality of the massage was top notch. Pool area is a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jewelzs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for my Birthday last month and had a great time. The hotel was a bit pricey for being right off the freeway, but the location makes up for that. Most of the hotels that are hidden and private have nothing around for miles. We walked to lunch and dinner both days we stayed. The room was great, beds were very confertable. The bathroom was beautiful. Loved the huge tub. I did not hear the construction once on our stay. However we did hear every person that walked by our room. The walls were obviously not that well insulated. I heard every step and word that went by our room. Luckliy it was a slow time and their were not many guests. Didn't bother us since it was seldom we heard them. We ended up paying more for a room than we had anticipated, but we enjoyed our stay. Great hotel, only draw back is that it is over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Charming spot in the heart of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: sm122097
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 5th (or is that 6th) stay at the Villagio, and, as always, we loved it. We checked in early, about noon, and was able to get a room immediately. It had a welcome bottle of champagne, a working fireplace, comfy bed, plenty of lights (a pet peeve of mine is not enough lights). The sink area had a large double sink and a separate room with the toilet and bath/shower (always a plus). The staff was incredibly helpful in arranging last minute dinner reservations and finding us a florist to use. In addition, after a fax I was supposed to receive never arrived, they opened up the business center late at night (around midnight) so I could get what I needed). Included in the price of the rooms was a buffet breakfast (with a decent -- but not a large -- selection of food. There was also high tea from 3-5 (while we did not go, when we the bellperson mentioned tea and scones and my wife said she really anted a scone, he arranged for 6 scones to be in our room when we arrived). And, as if you might not have had enough wine, there is an evening complimentary wine tasting. The facilities are very nice, with a warm pool and plenty of chairs for the sun. We have never used the spa (so we cannot comment) and the business centere is good (2 computers and a printer). I have stayed at both ends of the valley (both in downtown Napa and Calistoga) and prefer the Villagio's central location, making it not too far from any wineries. Plus, there are a number of very good restaurant in walking distance for the last few bottles of wine at dinner (on a related note, get the Strawberry shortcake at Hurley's on Younville during Strawberry season (March-October). We missed it this trip, but it is incredible. To comment on a review about being close to the highway, I have had rooms in the past that face the highway and sometimes you can hear the cars. However, this trip we had an inner courtyard and could not hear anything. Also, a note of caution, they are currently doing construction (I think to expand the spa). We were there on a weekend, so there was no construction going on. As a result, I cannot comment on what time the noise begins and how loud it is. We reservation note, you should call even if the website says they are booked. I checked on-line and got no availability. My wife called later the same day and got a reservation. We will return to Napa Valley and the Villagio Inn will be our first choice for the return

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bacigalupiman
Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 nights at the Yountville Inn across the street. I figured a room for $425 would be nice. The second we walked in, we knew we had been duped. I called the Villagio, hoping they might of had a cancellation. Yup, so we checked out of the Inn and moved across the street the next day. For about the same money, the Villagio is so much more of an experience. Rooms are very nice, the breakfasts were great, the spa was perfect. Highly recommend. If the Yountville Inn cut their prices by 50%, I might recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: roya_7
Reviews.Content: Right on the main road, the hotel is noisy, the rooms crowded together. It has a freeway motel feel. The room was so bad, the noise so discouraging, The food in the event room was rubbery and of poor quality. I left early. The pool, though warm, is small. Altogether a very bad deal for the Napa Valley which abounds with lovely places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jdvmd
Reviews.Content: Decided on a last-minute trip to Napa and could only get the Villagio for one night. Paid $265 for a midweek special through the Villagio website. We have been to Napa countless times and have stayed previously at the Vintage Inn, their sister property. Both properties are virtually identical except Vintage is a little bit smaller and is French themed, not Italian themed like the Villagio. Great proximity to wineries and restaurants. The free breakfast buffet every morning is nice with a wide variety of items but tables could have been cleaned more quickly as the birds decided to help themselves to the dirty dishes.
