Included in the room was a bottle of Beringer Chardonnay (chill in the refrigerator provided), a Duraflame firelog, robes, and two bottles of water were provided during the turndown service. Pool area seemed nice but was lacking a firepit like the Vintage Inn. Landscaping was beautiful and they obviously take care of it. Would I stay here again? Yes, because of the location. Was I wowed? No way. Our first floor room was incredibly dark and and there were touches that were original to when the place was built and just look out-of-date, not Old World Tuscan. If you have been to Italy, you know the theme just ain't so. Upon check-in, there was no mention of our anniversary or even a conversation except for "we need a credit card." They were training someone also. No USA Today was delivered and we never could get the Internet to work very fast and resorted to using our cellphone's blue tooth connection in order to get on. Finally, the noise. While I didn't hear anything regarding the huge construction project, I had the air conditioner running the entire night on high to block out the street noise and took along ear plugs. When sitting on our patio (Room 123), the highway noise was ridiculous. On top of it, housekeeping was rolling those big bins up and down the walkways next to the fountains. Again, I would stay there and I would rank this more in the 3.5 range, more than a three but a bit under a four.

Reviews.Title: “Walk right in, get 5 rooms!”
Reviews.Author: zoomer-7
Reviews.Content: So we walked right in after seeing this amazing property from the highway. A group of 8 needed 5 rooms - a challenge which I thought was stretching our luck, but no! The front desk team member was brilliant in offering a room rate we could not refuse - and to refuse the room rate would be silly - this place was beyond our expectations and worth every cent (but the discount from rack rate was "average") Having spent a big day in the Napa Valley, we were ready to relax and find a local restaurant to sample the fine fare on offer. The villa style property has the atmosphere of exclusivity and there are usually four rooms with each villa block. The architecture is very welcoming and the gardens are fantastic. When you walk into the room, a real "wow" feeling was certainly felt by all of our party - the rooms are spectacular; Large LCD TV, big bathroom, amazing furniture and a cute fireplace with a fire log to burn - well used later in the night to add a nice spark over wine and conversation after dinner. The pool is incredibly well appointed with massive day beds to relax and soak in the sun on. Service here is outstanding and attentive. So...onto my pro's and con's: CONS - not many but there were no views over mountains or anything spectacular but hey - you're there to relax and chill out by the pool and read a book. At the time we stayed, there was construction going on for new villas by the road. PRO'S - Great Restaurant down the road called Hurley's - GO THERE! the team there are brilliant and have a great sense of humour. Price of property is reasonable - service amazing - rooms are 15 out of 10. Location is excellent - Yountville is a great town and very historic. Go here. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Villagio in Yountville is great!”
Reviews.Author: winegirl10
Reviews.Content: This was the second (and last) stop on our trip to Wine Country. We stayed here three nights. This hotel is beautiful- the rooms are large, clean, and beautifully decorated. The staff is friendly and ready to accommodate you in any way possible. The pool area is gorgeous, as is all the landscaping on the property. The breakfast area is also beautiful and the food is delicious. After being in a smaller Inn in Healdsburg for two nights, I was a little worried that this would not measure up, but it was also a GREAT place to stay. I had read some reviews about this property on Trip Advisor before I booked and was worried about a noise problem. I am happy to report that it was not an issue for us at all. Yountville is a great town to stay in; great restaurants and everything is within walking distance. We would come back to Villagio again.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: cbernard1sc
Reviews.Content: Was so pleased to pull up into the Villagio in Yountville. Just precious! It was such a great location for doing wineries and put you so close to many great restaurants. We really loved Redd! Was hesitant about our stay because we had read about the noise complaints. We didn't notice that at all. The staff was super helpful and quick to act on our requests. We got upgraded to an interior room with the spa package which was a great deal for the area. Room was great with a nice big tub, a patio and fireplace. Am looking forward to the new spa completion and our next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Servicable hotel and Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: CACinLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villagio in November 2006 and most recently in July 2007. I had a better trip in July than last year. This hotel is wonderfully located for exploring vineyards in the Napa area. The free breakfast buffet every morning is fantastic. On weekends they even have an omlette station and waffle station. It's no skimpy continental breakfast for sure. We had some sort of suite room which was very nice. We were on the bottom floor though and could hear a lot of noise from upstairs. I liked the Molton Brown products in the bathrooms. The pool was busy and kid-filled but was still a nice place to sit. The gym is really just that guests can use a small, local gym nearby which was less than ideal. Basically, I'm not passionate about this hotel. It's more than basic and we enjoyed our stay. The amount of free food and wine is also to be appreciated. If you are looking for a hotel to really sink into like a resort, this is not the place. However, we were busy wine tasting, etc so this is a nice home base for those purposes. We also loved being able to walk across the street to Bistro Jeanty (try the mussels!) and Redd (good but not outstanding). The hotel rates are always about $300 which is a little high for the value of the stay. So, in all, we had a good time and would stay here again. There is nothing particularly inspired or special about the place though.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: yd700519
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely marvelous. The mediterranean style and very attractive rooms which include huge bathtubs, comfortable bed, excellent view and atmosphere are very relaxing. The hotel is close to restaurants ( I must recommend Bistro Jeanty - excellent food!), shopping, and other smaller cities such as St. Helenna. Nearby wine tasting sites are excellent, especially Darioush (beautiful winery!) You can go olive oil tasting in St. Helenna and enjoy freshly baked bread or sandwiches there. There's a also a casino about an hour and half away, but worth the drive. The massages at the spa were definately not the best, but they tried. The facility is clean, the pool is clean, the complimentary breakfast is excellent, especially the waffles. I will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: kristenthoms
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awesome, service was even better. Waiters by the pool got everything in a timely manner and we never had to flag anyone down. They are constantly making sure your comfort level is not only satisfactory but complete. Although the hotel is only 45 minutes from my home, I would have never guessed such a great establishment could have existed so close. I felt like I was in a tropical area, miles and miles away from home. It exceeded our expectations by miles. Also, the complimentary bottle of wine and champagne breakfast made it worth the trip in itself.

Reviews.Title: “How could I say something nice??”
Reviews.Author: lvnluxury
Reviews.Content: If I lived by the saying, "if you can't say anything nice, do not say anything at all" this review would be blank. My wife and I stayed one night here at the end of a fantastic Napa weekend. We will never stay here again. We arrived in business attire at 5:00 pm; we were ignored for 30 minutes before being checked in. No huge problem since there is a small bar in the lobby. It would have been better if the bartender knew the difference between a glass of sparkling wine and a glass of sparkling wine with some type of peach syrup in it. However, they do serve Paul Hobbs sav Blanc by the glass. Upon walking to our room, it looked as if this was a Residence Inn with a small canal and fountains cut into the sidewalk. The rooms were decorated with shoddy furniture at best. In our room, there was a descent bottle of white wine. However, no ice! After 15 minutes of waiting for ice to be delivered, I called to see if an ice machine was available and was made to feel like I had never stayed in such a nice place and that she would "check on" my ice. Another 15 minutes went by and I found an ice machine around the corner. The wake up call never came! (Thank god I set the alarm on my phone) Breakfast is presented nicely. But if you are not into a food trough with people and children grabbing the bagel from your plate I would recommend skipping it. I wish that I knew of a better place in the area but as of now, I do not. I will however, post it here after our next Napa weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: djr76
Reviews.Content: This hotel forces you to relax. The property is beautiful, fountains line all the pathways, the grounds are lush and you really feel like you are very far removed. The staff and service at the hotel was fantastic and very accommodating. Our room, suite 249, was huge and in the middle of the hotel property and far away from the freeway and noise. The bed was very comfortable; the room quiet and very nicely decorated. The room had a sitting room, balcony, fireplace and Jacuzzi bathtub. The pool area is an absolute sanctuary; they have several cabanas that have beds, perfect place to lounge in the shade near the pool. The hotel lobby has a full bar and there are several complimentary dispensers of juice, iced tea and water.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Queen_of_the_hw
Reviews.Content: We wanted a great location where we could walk to restaurants at night and experience some wonderful napa wine tastings. At Villagio were we spoilt for choice of culinary delights on our doorstep. When we arrived we were warmly welcomed by the friendly staff. Our room was beautiful with a view of a vineyard outside our balcony and a fireplace that we light each night. The room itself is very well equipped with a large bathroom area and a nice seating area outside. There is a lovely heated pool area where the surroundings are decorated in the style of an italian town. The only downside is that it is near a busy road at the back. I always sleep well (on vacation!) and am used a city hum, however but if you are a light sleeper you will notice the highway noise. The breakfast in Villagio is great, lovely atmosphere, great choice of food and a lovely start to a day. Villagio is currently under construction of a new spa but we were unaffected by this during our stay it just makes me want to return when it is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful visit!”
Reviews.Author: ferdmcberf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Villagio 4 or 5 times and each experience is wonderfull! From the beautifully maintained grounds to the breakfast buffet and afternoon tea there is much to enjoy. I do agree that the cost of some of the rooms is a bit high but as a returning guest we enjoy special deals from the hotel. I wish all of the rooms had a jetted tub like it's sister property the Vintage Inn, but that is a minor complaint. Both Inns are highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The Villagio Was Perfect For Us!”
Reviews.Author: syrahgirl
Reviews.Content: First of all I'll start out by saying that there is construction going on in the front of the Villagio, they are building a new spa that will be complete in 2008. We were not effected in any way by the noise of the construction. We arrived around 5:00 and we were upgraded to an inner perimeter room which is more quiet than the outer perimeter rooms. Our room was very nice, there is a long walkway of fountains that runs by the rooms, we had views of the fountains from each of our windows in our room. When we arrived there were snacks set out and tea, small croissants and freshly baked homemade cookies. Our room was very nice, a bottle of wine was waiting for us in our room, the bed was comfy, there was a fireplace which we used in the evening and in the morning and a nice sunken tub. There was granite on the countertops, robes, turndown service in the evening. After dinner at Ad Hoc which is right across the street, we wanted to use the jacuzzi which was out of order, but the attendant assured us it would be working in the morning which it was. After dinner we enjoyed relaxing in the lobby with the piano player, the lobby was candlelit and very pretty. Breakfast the next morning was amazing, Champagne set out, lots of different items on the buffet. We sat outside and enjoyed tha ambiance there. The pool area was very nice for swimming after breakfast and relaxing. There are king size padded lounge chairs with cabanas that are very nice. Water with lemon was also set out and nice, soft candy cane striped towels. I enjoyed a soak in the jacuzzi after breakfast, also. The concierge gave us complimentary tasting passes to several wineries in the area. We loved everything about our stay here. What a location! Right across the street from Redd and Ad Hoc where we enjoyed meals. We also were given a pass for a complimentary glass of wine at Domaine Chandon which we enjoyed out on the patio there. The fountains, the pool, Champagne breakfast, nice room, great location. This is now my favorite place to stay in Yountville. Very nice memories were made at the Villagio, it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly ...”
Reviews.Author: Heavenlytraveller
Reviews.Content: The Villagio Inn & Spa is heavenly! - Why I should tell you something about it. Everything is perfect. JUST HEAVENLY! Nicest place on Earth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JMH69
Reviews.Content: The Villagio Inn & Spa was simply wonderful. I am a Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons traveler, and I believe all the positive reviews given so far are 100% correct. I will focus on a couple of practical highlights that have not been mentioned. First, unlike many resorts that charge extra for every "service," the Villagio Inn offers service with a smile and no charge. For example, wi-fi service is available throughout the inn (not just the lobby) free of charge. Also, the business center does not charge for access, printing or faxing services. They do not even charge guests an "extra" fee for shipping wines back home. Second, the outdoor pool is heated and so enjoyable even during a relatively mild winter, such as this January/February. Third, the concierge (Josh) was wonderful and gave many great recommendations. The restaurant Redd, across the street, was nothing short of amazing. The town of Yountville is small, but appears to be the culinary hub of the valley and so wonderful experiences are all within walking or biking distance. My only complaint would be that neither my boyfriend nor I were impressed by the massages we received at the spa. Also, during my entire massage and while in the ladies dressing room I overheard a conversation, I later discovered was being carried on by two men sitting on a bench just outside the spa doors. How the sound seeped into the rooms I'll never know. But the Villagio is building a new spa expected to open Spring 2008, which will hopefully have sound-proofed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrieag1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are in need of a face lift. The spa is tiny and I had an awful expierence trying to make an appointment to fit my schedule. There is only one shower in the womans spa, and there were three woman waiting for a shower. The massage was very good, but when I complained, I was offered 20% off my service.. I have a hard time with the name "spa" with such a tiny service area. The concierge was no help at all. I have seen the rates this place charges for summer and can't believe they get away with it. Otherwise, it is a nice town and close to all the wonderful things Napa has to offer. Great Breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were looking for and more.”
Reviews.Author: Hous2ntx
Reviews.Content: We spent three amazing nights at the Villagio. Let me first say that the Concierge Colby did an amazing job organizing our trip and ensuring that the restuarants, wineries, driver etc were booked, confirmed, and organized. She not only organized them in perfect order but selected a wide variety that would show us the vast differences in the area.. The room was fantastic. Fireplace, soft pillow top bed and down pillows. The complimentary breakfast buffet was extensive and delicious. Great coffee and tea. The staff was friendly and helpful. As far as we are concerned this is the best place to stay in the area. As for the wineries we visited several but I have to call attention to one in particular...Del Dotto. Luckily we saved this one for the end of the day. The wine was fantastic, the caves were amazing and the tour was like no other. We had a blast. Ask for Matt...He was histerical, entertaining and made the tour PERFECT. This is one winery that will see us each and every time we visit...3 cheers to Matt and a fantastic Cave Blend. This was a perfect trip and I am certain we will be back

Reviews.Title: “perfect napa experience”
Reviews.Author: suegilfIllinois
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of reviews from trip advisor...some great, but others from people whining...I just needed to say that we had such a wonderful visit there!!! Very nice room (and we like the Ritz and Four Season kind of spot) and perfect location (great restaurants- walking distance)! GREAT champagne breakfast...every gourmet food available!! Great tea in the afternoon....cute bar and wonderful service from all the staff. Noooo highway noise (who would be on that remote highway at night????) So, LOVED it and would return...cute town...cute inn....loved Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet and tucked away spot”
Reviews.Author: christigpa
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Villagio, both visits were lovely. While the property is building a new spa (current facility is still open) we were not bothered by construction noise even once (Rm 240 was an upper level interior unit). We slept with the deck door open to fall asleep to the sound of the water fountain (not the traffic as some may claim). The property does back up to a highway portion of Route 29 but I only heard the highway once or twice on this stay and not once on my stay last spring. The beds are by far some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in, including my own. Hotel now stocks Molton Brown toiletries which are a little "manly" in scent for me but my BF loved them. Bathroom has plenty of space for two to spread out and plenty of towels. The two (very large) Turkish cotton robes were nice when cuddled in front of our nightly fire. (For those complaining about not having "real" firewood, Duraflames are much safer and store better than firewood.) Each night we asked for a second log so we could sleep with a fire going all night - really romantic treat. A small fridge is perfect for leftovers and chilling a bottle of wine. Two large bottles of Evian were delivered to our room twice at no charge. The breakfast is amazing, it impressed me last Spring and it was just as good as I remembered it. It is hearty and filled me up past lunchtime each day. Just the right amount of food to begin the day wine tasting! The business center is open 24/7 with free computer and Internet access (didn't bring the laptop this time). Any business traveler will appreciate small benefits like free business center access - even if just to briefly check email and print out a boarding pass. Each visit I've had to ship home business materials and the front desk has always been helpful. Last time they took my 12 bottles of wine and contracted through an outside shipping company to send to my home in PA. I have yet to try the spa portion of this property, the prices are a little high for me. They have a lovely heated pool with poolside cabanas that we meant to try out each evening but never got around to it. One thing I do like about the Villagio that stands out from other properties - you can walk around to lots of cute shops and eateries - from the good mexican place to Bouchon's to the French Laundry. In between the Vintage Inn (sister property) there are also a number of shops. Only one problem surfaced during this recent stay: since the weather was unseasonably cold, we used our heater. One of the dials was broken and took two conversations with the front desk before maintenance came to repair. They did leave an apology note and indicated that the dial had been fixed - which for the most part it was. It worked fine the next two nights. Enjoy your stay at the Villagio. Feel free to contact me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Location and concierge are the only saving grace”
Reviews.Author: lptraveler
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on noise, I was sure to pay the extra for an interior courtyard room. I requested a quiet room for our six night stay. We arrived to a warm reception and flowers in the front were just great. Unfortunately, when went to our room, we found it to be the second door in from their new construction site. No one mentioned this construction project to us at any point, not upon booking, not upon asking for a quiet room, not upon check in -Never! The only mention of the construction is a poster in the lobby and at the spa with a rendering of the new building and what it would contain. On a visit to another hotel earlier this year, we received a letter and gift certificate towards a future stay in the new section, even though no work took place while we were there. See my review of the Royal Palms in Phoenix. It was Sunday when we checked in and I thought maybe the construction would not be taking place during our stay, that maybe it was just unsightly. Well, 9am the following morning, I realized I was wrong. Now the hours of construction were only from 9-4:30, not really bad if you were out all day. But at $359 per night, being unable to take a nap in your guestroom in the afternoon is just plain unreasonable! I did address this with the desk and they told me that we were indeed in an 'interior' room. They adjusted our rate to that of an 'exterior room' but could not move us as they were fully booked. The inconvenience we experienced for six days was not addressed to my satisfaction. I brought this up to the front desk agent who checked me out, but she was unsympathetic. The room was bare bones, dishes and glasses were constantly not removed during evening turndown service and I totally agree with the review regarding the duraflame log and the tacky fake artifacts. At about $150 less per night these items would not seem so important, but at $359 for a first floor room, this is not on par with other resorts in the industry. The spa staff was very friendly and professional, but the layout was substandard: you had to walk past treatment rooms to use the steam or sauna which is distracting while you are in your service. There was only one shower in the men's and ladies' changing areas with a filmsy shower curtain (not luxurious) and so the lockers (think rollerskate rink, not four diamond resort) would get soaked. There were hairdryers but no brushes. I do hope that they correct these items once the new spa is constructed . My husband requested a female massage therapist, but when we changed the times of our appointments the request was neglected. He lived, but it is indicative of a larger issue. The concierge, Mary, was wonderful and she really should be commended for going out of her way for guests. She was the reason that we did not try to change hotels, although we visited another property across the street that was less expensive and considered moving. The location of the property is wonderful. It is within walking distance to the very best restaurants and galleries in Yountville. We loved Redd and Bistro Jeanty and Mary even got us reservations at The French Laundry. Overall, if the hotel had not set the bar so high with its room rates, we may not have been so disappointed. I inquired about a comment card upon check out and was told one would be emailed to me. I have not received it, but have already received comment cards from wineries we visited that same day. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky rip-off”
Reviews.Author: MindyH
Reviews.Content: Overpriced would be an understatement. The hotel is located conveniently next to the highway and the constant stream of eighteen-wheelers rattled our headboard. However the traffic may have served to drown out most of the sounds of construction (I believe they are building new spa facilities). Our room was not as described on the hotel website - NO sunken tub and was poorly designed: the makeup mirror hung at 6' would be of no use to most women and the closet was clearly designed by someone who had never hung up clothes (the distance between the rods would not accomodate a shirt or pants much less a dress and the lower rod blocked suitcase access). The fireplace would be charming if you enjoyed the ambiance and chemical smell of the single duraflame log allowed. The Villagio's breakfast, a bottle of champagne set on a continental breakfast buffet, was not what I expect from a "luxury" hotel. Villagio's idea of "Tuscany in the Napa Valley" is a few fountains and some rather crass fake ruins and artifacts. It is a hokey rendition worthy of a theme park. Kudos to the website photographer who managed to make some very mediocre amenities look luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: SuperTuscan777
Reviews.Content: When I booked our stay back in January, Villagio had nearly all excellent ratings. When my wife checked it two weeks ago, she was so freaked by the recent bad reviews that she asked me to cancel and book somewhere else. I decided to keep our reservations and am extremely glad I did. In short, Villagio was absolutely superb. And I must admit that curiousity got the best of me and I pushed them in ways I normally don't. I asked to see at least three other rooms before I rested our bags and they happily showed us around. I had the concierge (Mary) book us for last second wine tastings/tours every morning and she was wonderful. I called house cleaning and they were up everytime within minutes. The entire grounds were immaculate. However, I did book an upstairs king, so I had no experience with the complaints from people who've booked a ground floor room. The Bistro Jeanty across the street was fabulous. Best Wine Tasting/Tours: Opus One, Mondavi and Darioush. All three were extremely professional to the max. Avoid: Joseph Phelps. I am a fan of their Insignia line and was stunned to witness the two crude, obnoxious cretins they had at their tasting (if management cares, it was Friday July 7th about Noon). Where did they find these guys? The local pool hall? A woman politely asked if they still gave production tours. One of these jerks replied, "Come with me into the woods, I'll give you a production." Absolutely disgraceful and I will never touch their wine again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE! Ignore negative reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: VTBunny00
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying here based on some of the negative reviews. I will tell you that I LOVED this place. We booked an interior downstairs room and upon check in we were upgraded to a suite which was awesome!! I didn’t see the standard room so I’m not sure if we would have enjoyed it as much but our suite was amazing! The grounds were absolutely beautiful and the service was exceptional. The resort was much larger then I expected too. The staff always completed everything with ‘my pleasure’ and went out of their way to make you feel comfortable. The pool was great and they had little cabanas you could sit at and relax in the shade. The breakfast- OH BOY!! It was to die for!! All of the freshest ingredients and SO much to choose from. By far the best breakfast buffet I have ever seen! We received a bottle of wine when we arrived in our room and then a bottle of champagne was delivered later in the evening compliments of the hotel (it was our anniversary). Every evening they turned down the bed and provided two bottled waters. I know this is silly but it was a nice touch- even in the nicest places I have stayed you still have to fork out $5 for water and these were complimentary. So the linens weren’t 600 thread count but I slept comfortably. It was an expensive stay but given what everything else cost in Napa I think it was a good value. We were in a downstairs room and we did hear some walking upstairs but nothing that we wouldn’t hear in our own house. Sitting outside by the pool which was near the parking lot I did not hear traffic from highway 29. The location was perfect for us- centrally located in Napa Valley. I would definitely stay here again if we were to return to Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: napagirl2
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visit Yountville and Napa we always want to stay at Villagio Inn and Spa. Yes, it can be noisy if you get a room near the highway. Our friends have stayed there and they sleep through anything and still love the place. It has a wonderful ambience with the fountains. The landscaping is gorgeous. It is so convenient to walk across the street to the ranch market (local grocery store) or any restaurant in Yountville. The pool is nice and the staff is always very attentive. The champagne breakfast buffet is soooo good. All you can eat and drink. You wlll love it! Our only complaint is that lately it seems like more and more people are bringing children to this place. I think it should be for couples only. Sometimes the kids get noisy and take over the pool. Usually if the adults hit the pool in the morning or late afternoon they get more peace and quiet. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Villagio-- Good for Parents AND Kids”
Reviews.Author: amf1
Reviews.Content: Needing a room for the night due to a family wedding and being a family of four (two kids ages 5 and 7), we were having a difficult time finding a hotel in Yountville that permitted children and cost substantially less than four hundred dollars a night. We were delighted to find an internet "Romance Package" special on the Villagio's website for $250/night for a downstairs room with two queen beds; the romance package itself seemed to consist of the accommodations and a chilled bottle of champagne. We laughed at the idea of booking a romance package with two young children, but it was a great rate and so we booked it. Afterwards, I read many of the reviews on TA and was slightly concerned. Folks commented on the high cost of the room versus the value offered, complained of freeway noise, and disparaged the rooms as being loud and of poor or Motel 6-like quality. Fortunately, we found ourselves disagreeing with almost all of these poor reports. It is true that the hotel is located extremely near the highway and that, if you are in the pool, the parking lot, or in the rooms on that side of the resort, you will probably notice highway noise (of the zip-zip of cars ilk). This was not an overwhelming roar of noise, but it was obvious and I was glad that we were not in one of the rooms next to the parking lot (for many reasons, of course, but sitting on one's patio would clearly be far less pleasant there). We could not hear the highway from anywhere else on the hotel grounds (including the fountain walkway) except for the pool (it was more muted there, but still audible). We were in a bottom floor room that was the very end room next to the service road and the main Yountville road and heard no noise: no traffic, no persons upstairs, no one walking around the resort. It was peaceful, quiet, and relaxing. We found the room itself to look very much like the website pictures: sort of an Arizona-esque blend of woods and creams. Personally, we liked this very much. The linens on the bed were lovely, with wine-colored duvets, plenty of pillows, and soft mattresses. Our children were delighted to find the beds turned down and decorated with chocolates. There was a wood-burning fireplace (ready with a fire log), a sitting area by the windows (covered with lovely dark wood shutters), and then a dressing/wet bar area, a large closet and double sink, and a separate toilet/tub. The bathroom was very nice with an extra-deep tub, but this would not be my idea of a romantic soaking tub (perhaps I have been spoiled by Vegas and French Polynesia-- this was nice, but nothing that my bubble-bath addicted self was in a hurry to enjoy). Apparently, all of the rooms come with a complimentary bottle of chardonnay; there are also ample coffee and tea making supplies. A pleasant surprise (particularly since we were travelling with the kids) was the empty mini-bar fridge-- we had a place to store drinks and snacks. One of the most pleasant surprises about the hotel, however, was the level of service. We arrived at noon: they checked us in immediately. They provided us with a map and directions on where was best to park and how to find our room. Someone accompanied me to our room, showed me around, and placed the Chardonnay in the fridge to chill. He also asked what time we would like our champagne chilled and delivered that evening. Since we were attending a wedding, we picnicked in the room for an hour (although it seemed criminal to let kids near those duvets): there is a convenient liquor store/market across the street with child-friendly fare along with room service and numerous restaurants within walking distance. We picnicked, filled up the trash can, disassembled the beds, and left. When we returned shortly after nine o'clock, we found our champagne waiting for us (along with two bottles of Evian water) and that housekeeping had come and tidied up after us, remaking the beds, adding more chocolates, and emptying the trash. This was lovely and completely unexpected. The double distribution of chocolate has certainly set the bar for my children (who took to the concept after we explained "turn down service" to them). We all ate at the champagne brunch the next morning. It was quite nice and certainly provided all the fixings for mimosas. There were fresh fruit (both whole pieces such as apples and bananas and sliced melons, strawberries, kiwis, etc.), yoghurts, cereals, French pastries, a cheese and antipasto plate, toast, jams, two baked egg dishes, potatoes, bread pudding with poached pears, and a variety of other lovely things. Even my extremely picky seven year-old managed to eat breakfast (we appreciated the less exotic assortment of bananas and grapes in particular... although the buffet is elegantly set up and at first glance seems oriented more towards adults than children, there were plenty of familiar choices when you looked beyond the plating). Coffee could also be taken with you in paper coffee cups; there was always a large, iced display of bottled water by the front door for the taking. Other than walking around a bit and enjoying the many fountains, fish ponds, and little wooden bridges, our kids enjoyed time in the pool. Although you can hear some freeway noise, the main pool is a beautiful, relaxing place (we were slightly horrified to come in with our two kids): there are plenty of lounge chairs, about ten large, curtain draped cabanas, and a number of free pool floats. The housekeeping service at the pool was particularly impressive: they kept all of the lounge chairs and cabanas stocked with rolled, fresh towels and made three sweeps for dirty, abandoned towels in the hour and a half we spent in the pool. This meant that the pool area stayed tidy and that towels were always available. There was also a very hot hot tub that we all enjoyed. We attempted to be respectful of the other guests (women relaxing on the pool floats and loungers, reading) and kept our children somewhat quiet and refrained from cannon-balling into the pool; the other guests seemed not to mind our slightly noisy swimming. It was, frankly, nice to find a place so relaxing and elegant that was also child-friendly (we saw several families of three, with a smaller toddler or baby in a stroller while we were there). In short, if we were ever in wine country again, we would not hesitate to stay at the Villagio. The rooms were large, spacious and well-appointed; the front desk bent over backwards to help us; and we thoroughly enjoyed breakfast and the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out within 5 minutes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel deceives - the lobby and exterior are lovely, but the rooms are HORRID. They are dark, and cheaply decorated. The freeway noise is so loud one cannot carry on a conversation. We had apparently booked their "best" room for $550 a night. It was dreadful. We were fortunate that Meadowood had a last-minute cancellation. Turned out the "most modest" room at Meadowood was substantially nicer than the best room at Villagio - and cheaper. One positive about Villagio was that they refunded our deposit right away. I think they horrified reactions often and so they handle them well. If you are looking for an elegant, romantic luxury hotel - DO NOT GO TO VILLAGIO.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Villagio Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Vallagio Inn and we also had a fabulous time. This is wine country not downtown Paris. The rooms were all decorated with a tuscany theme. There was granite, new carpet and everything was clean. I think the dark wood theme throws people off as being old. The rooms were huge. We stayed at Le Maurice in Paris in October and that was more "ritz like" We were not looking for that in Napa. You will not find it. The courtyard/fountains was also beautiful surrounding the rooms. The health club was also perfect or a morning workout before breakfeast and wine tasting. The rooms are perfect for the quaintness of Napa and the wine country. The tub was oversized and clean. The concierge, Mary was great and very helpful. Do not compare $400.00-$500.00 in a city hotel to that of the valley inns. The employees at the hotel could not do enough for us. Elizabeth who worked at the front desk set the whole tone of our getaway by her friendliness and smile. The buffet was also great. On weekends they have the omelette bar and waffle bar. I think the people who complain about the food are used to their grand slam breakfeast at Denny's. I honestly believe that the people who complain about this hotel can never be pleased. My wife is from NYC and very critical and she had a great time w/o complaint. We rented a convertible with a GPS and that made all the difference while exploring Silverado Trail. Don't miss the Schramsburg winery tour, well worth the $25.00 per person which includes wine tasting. Peju was also a great winery, along with MUMS. The outlet stores in NAPA are ok to get away from the winery for a few hours. Some stores include Barney's, Ann Taylor, Boise and the usual outlet stores. Anyways, as frequent travelers, we cannot say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what all these negative reviewers are talking about!! My husband I have traveled to numerous destinations all over the world and usually stay in 4 or 5 star resorts. We figure if you are going away enjoy yourself! I think people are very hard to please and very spoiled! With that said.. here is my review. We had a downstairs interior room. No highway noise. That request was made based on the fact it was a commen complaint throughout the reviews. Thus, we had no noise at all except the fountains that line some of the rooms. Room was large with a fireplace and very nice comfortable bed. The bathroom had a nice seperate dressing area and the bathtub was a soaking tub for two medium sized adults. They do give you a scented candle in the bathroom as well as a larger one in the main area. Very romantic. I did not see any stains on carpet or bedding. All furniture was tasteful and in line with the style of the inn. Breakfast was amazing! Tons of fresh fruits, fresh squeezed juices. omelette and waffle station with fresh berries, cheeses,muffins, bagels.etc. I can not fathom how some reviewers commented the breakfast was horrible. What else would they want or need? At 6pm there was a very nice wine tasting from a local vineyard. In addition, there were various cheeses and fruits. Very nice before dinner! Overall, we had a lovely time and would definitely go again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: anna011
Reviews.Content: I had such high hopes for the Villagio, and was a little disappointed. The rooms are just not that nice. They are sizable, but they seem old and plain. There was nothing luxurious about them, and certainly not the bathrooms. We did pay extra (nearly $400) for an "interior" room and we did not hear any traffic. That said, the pool looked nice and the breakfast and afternoon tea were fine. Not incredble, but certainly adequate. We would not come back here again. One note though, I had one of the best meals ever at Bistro Jeanty...very fresh and flavorful!

Reviews.Title: “$400 per night for this?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money... at nearly $400 per night (which included a AAA discount) for a suite, it was a complete disappointment. Had it been around $200 I might feel otherwise but... Number one on the list of shotcomings is the highway noise. I even requested a room away from the highway... what did I get? A room less than 50 yards from highway 29. The ONLY time it was quiet was between 1 -5 am. As far as the room goes, it was relatively spacious but the furnishings we're just a step above IKEA. Cheap towels and robes too. A terrible breakfast. Remember dorm food? this was not much better. The staff seemed like they were borrowed from a Red Roof Inn. And don't even bother expressing your your dissatisfaction. When I did it was met with a shrug and an indifferent "sorry". Will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Great Atmosphere - Good staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this fine inn for one evening. Not sure what the last couple were complaining about but our stay was excellent. We had a upstairs room facing the pool. We had no problem with room noise but I could see someone in a room close to the highway would be annoyed. Other then that everything was excellent. Staff was very friendly and greeted quickly. They were all eager to please. Room decor was good but not excellent. If you stay try PJ's Steak for dinner. It is one of the best meals we have had in the valley in a long time. Overall way above average and we plan on taking the family back this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Overrated, Cheesy, and Loud”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pay attention to the reviewers who complained about the road noise at the Villagio - they're right! The highway noise competes with passing trains, upstairs guests' footsteps, running water, a cheap heating system, and croaking frogs for your attention all night long. The overall decor scheme of the place is Rome meets Las Vegas - an eclectic mix of styles with some fountains and cheesy statues thrown in - it would impress someone who doesn't get out much. The room/suite was large and neat, but not especially clean (the carpet and soft furnishings all had stains on them), and the front desk staff was surly. The service otherwise was very good, although I felt sorry for them trudging from room to room and building to building in the rain (very Motel 6 architecture!). The food was wonderful (buffet and room service), but I'd expect a restaurant on the premises at a resort hotel in this price range. All in all, it wasn't a dreadful stay, but I expected more and was disappointed with the generally artificial, hokey feeling of the place. I wouldn't stay there again unless I was assured of an upstairs unit away from the highway and someone else was paying for it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bad experience - poor service - location on the highway - too much highway noise - much better choices than this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Jenn31
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Villagio! My boyfriend and I just spent an evening at the Villagio for a romantic getaway and we had a wonderful time! We had booked and outside courtyard room at $225 and upon arrival they had upgraded us to an inside courtyard room. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous from the moment we arrived everything was taken care of. Check in was a breeze, we were given a great recomendation for an early Dinner at Hurleys except after sitting down to eat the power went out due to a downed telephone pole. The staff lit candles (we were the only two in the restaurant) and we had a few drinks before going back to our room and ordering room service. He had some kind of beef with mashed potatoes and baby vegetables and I being the vegetarian had the pear salad with some kind of cheese and a fantastic balsamic dressing. Are room was quite large and very plush. And the bed was very comfortable. In the evening we opened a bottle of sparkling wine that we had brought with us and moved our two ottomans in front of the fireplace. We sat in front of the fire for a few hours until it started to die out and then we called down for another log which arrived promptly. At around 10pm that evening the front desk called to say that the bellman had a special delivery, I figured they had the wrong room. My sweetie had mentioned it was my birthday on making our reservations and they had sent up a bottle of sparkling wine and two flutes with a birthday card! I thought that was a wonderful touch. The vanity area was very large and the robes were very comfortable. Late that night we decided to try out the tub and ran a bubble bath, with two people in the tub it was pergect with a little room to spare. Instead of going down to the free breakfast in the morning we opted for room service breakfast in bed. I had the seasonal fruit and berries with mint honey sauce and he had the egg and cheese croissant with breakfast potatoes and we both had the fresh squeezed oj. It truly was a memorable romantic evening. And we can't wait to go back! For anyone thinking of choosing this property, don't hesitate to book, it will be an evening you'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Flood of 2005”
Reviews.Author: set2sail
Reviews.Content: My husband and friends and I checked into the Villagio on Thursday, December 29th. It was lightly drizzling, but the fireplace in the reception area was warm and inviting. In the morning, the rain continued, but the beautiful champagne breakfast by the fireplace warmed our spirits and encouraged us to go tasting. More rain and our friends had a massage scheduled, so my husband and I dropped them back at the Villagio after just one winery. We decided to try our appointment in Calistoga, and as we pulled into Chateau Montelena, we heard a flood warning on the news. Not knowing exactly where we were in relation to the water, we pushed on. We weathered a 2 hour tour that took us outdoors through ankle deep flood water, but had a great adventure. Of course our trip back to the Villagio was worse, as the rain was coming down so hard that it was nearly impossible to see the flood barriers. We made it back and woke up New Years Eve to find out that some eight inches of rain had fallen overnight. We kept hearing and seeing fire trucks that were going out to rescue people trapped in their homes or cars stuck in the water. No one was sure which roads were open, so after another fabulous breakfast, we ventured out to our appointment at Niebaum-Coppola. It was like Chevy Chase pulling up to Wally World in "Vacation." The gates were locked and no one was answering the phones there. We decided to drive on and nearly got trapped in St. Helena by the flash flood that ensued. We went south of Yountville, thinking the roads would be better. Instead we got about 3 minutes down Route 29 to find the highway under several feet of water. A few cars had been caught in the water and even a bus was floating across Route 29! We went back to the Villagio to find the other guests of the sold out hotel wandering around. We decided to suck it up and head to the awesome outdoor hot tub and heated pool. The staff gave us a bottle of champagne from the brunch, and eventually bent the rules for us to have champagne and food in the hot tub/pool area. If you didn't know that there was a natural disaster going on outside the walls of the hotel, the staff would never have given it away. I have to give Colby the concierge the highest marks, as she not only calmly dealt with the stranded guests, but when our New Years Eve dinner reservations at Domaine Chandon were cancelled (a lot of restaurants didn't have staff to open)she busted her butt to find us another place to celebrate on such a crazy night. Despite the rain, the service was impeccable and we enjoyed our stay at the Villagio Inn and Spa. We would love to come back when the weather is better. I can't wait!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: work2travel70
Reviews.Content: All right... Loved this location..... All those that have stated Sonoma is better... I disagree.. I LOVE everything about Napa and Yountville is the perfect central location as well as the VILLAGIO being the best place to stay. Grounds are beautiful Town has everything Rooms and especially bathrooms are very nice and they go way above in terms of breakfast that is included. Had a facial at the spa and would recommend the spa too.. They had a lot of products in the bathrooms at the spa that made it like a separate treatment on its own. We stayed on the first floor by the pool in a suite with a fireplace. Basically a extra large hotel room, nothing over the top but traveling with kids nice to have a little extra space. We stayed our last two nights of our vacation here and it was the perfect end to a wonderful holiday. One side note to mention...If we are able to go back I would request a 2nd floor room. All of the post are correct in saying you can hear every step upstair from down below.. It didn't really bother us we were so tired and were still able to enjoy the room and sleep but given the choice request a second floor room. Kinda strange side note.. Try the fresh lemonade at night..The lemons are grown right on property. In the mornining they had the best egg salad we have ever had..Never a big egg salad fan but are now.. Wonderful pool area love the queen size chaise lounges and love the view of the fountians down the entire inside corridor on the property. Some ofthe guest are ridiculous... Each morning we were entertained by loud obnoxious showy people. One party were gushing how every bit of the 2,000 dollar dinner was worth it the night before and then the next morning an engaged couple talked way too loud about if they made more money than the people they had asked to be in their wedding. Can we say money doesn't buy happiness or class, but it sure is nice when it helps you stay in nice places as the Villagio. I was comfortable paying the 250.00 a night receiving an upgrade and a bottle of wine as well as champagne. With all the other things included, well worth it. We look forward to returning to the Villagio one day....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MaineSherpa
Reviews.Content: We visit Napa Valley once a year in November for an annual culinary conference, and we usually stay in St. Helena. This was the first year in Yountville at the Villagio, and it was great. The rooms are nice, wonderful bedding, very comfortable, and the breakfast and afternoon tea were first class. In addition, the pool is heated and very nice, the grounds are lovely, and the location is perfect. Yountville is a very nice town with restaurants, markets and shops all in walking distance. We did not go to the French Laundry, but I am sure that others in the hotel did. This is a fancy place with a little of that Napa Valley pretense - everyone is so sophisticated about wine and the finer things in life. I would not call it snobbery, but there is an air of "The Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous". Add that together with early morning hangovers and you get a bit of the the uptightness that is no fault of the Villagio, but it there, nonetheless. We got a call from the front desk because we were walking too loud across the floor one morning for the occupants below. Oh well. Anyway, that is no reason to rule this place out. If you can afford it, this is the place. Wake up early and watch the balloons take off over the hotel. Wow.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights and 3 days at the Villagio in mid-November. The room was beautiful and we loved the fireplace in the room. We had reserved a 1st floor king room but were upgraded to the 2nd floor room with an inner courtyard view without even asking. The view of the fountains from the blacony was amazing. My wife and I both enjoyed masssages at the spa which was also great. The complimentary breakfasts in the morning were amazing. There are plenty of excellent restaurants within walking distance including Bouchon and the Wine Garden. Also, the location of the hotel in "wine country" was excellent - right in the middle of things. Overall, you can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three days at the Villagio Inn and Spa during the first week in October. The room was an inner court suite on the second floor. Although we were near the highway, the noise was minimal. The decor of the room was gorgeous and the bed was very comfortable. The setup of the room was convenient because there was an alcove with a sitting area to read in without disturbing my husband in the morning. We loved the grounds so much that we went to a local grocery and bought some nice sandwiches, cheeses, wine, chocolate and had a romantic dinner by the outdoor fireplace - it was like heaven. Breakfast was great and the pool was awesome. I will definitely return to Villagio......

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniversary Destination!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved every minute of my stay at Villagio. My husband and I were celebrating our first anniversary and the hotel could not have been a more perfect place to do just that! We were greeted with a glass of champagne and a free upgrade upon walking into the gorgeous lobby. Our room was gorgeous and clean and very spatious. However, I don't think we'd be at all disappointed in the highway facing rooms - they looked lovely and it wasn't that loud. Our porch was the pefect place to recap the day's events. The hotel put 2 little champagne splits in our room and a card wishing us a happy anniversary. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more friendly. Napa is a bit sleepy - we're night people and with the exception of the restaurants (you just have to walk across the street to Bouchon or Bistro Jeanty to get an amazing meal), there is little to do. The hotel's pool is open 24 hours and the room is nice to retire early in! The buffet breakfast was absolutely amazing - I gained 20 lbs in 3 days because I had to try everything! All around, a perfect place to relax and we both highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our trip to Napa and right away I knew that I had to write a review. Villagio was an amazing place to stay. The rooms are spacious, the pool area is beautiful, the staff was extremely courteous, and you can't ask for a better location. Staying at the Villagio made our trip that much more special!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this great property twice. We learned from the first time--you must book an INTERIOR room. That way you do not hear the highway all night. Yes, the interior rooms costs more--however you will thank yourself when you awake from a good nights sleep!! Rooms in general are very clean and spacious, service is very good as well. The spa could use some help--it's very small, however the grapeseed wrap I had was outstanding! Pool area is very nice and relaxing. The free continental breakfast in the morning actually fills you up for a day's wine tasting adventure. The location is great, walking distance to some of the greatest restaurants in the Valley. Our fave, Bouchon--be sure you eat outside however (inside gets a little crowded and noisy). All in all, I think this is a great value for the Valley--we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility for a Special Occasion”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBern
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding facility. The staff is first class and highly attentive creating a very friendly and comfortable atmosphere. The rooms are large and plush with a complimentary bottle of wine. There is not much in the way of grounds except a beautiful 'fountain' walkway. The spa is small but has a sauna, steamroom, etc with a very friendly staff. Very nice, large pool area. There is also a wonderful buffet breakfast included. Everything is all around excellent. Yountville is a beautiful little town. Very clean and upscale. If you are looking for a place to spend a special occasion, this is it (it was our anniversary). Remember you are paying for all this. It is very pricey. But, as they say, you get what you pay for and I think we got a lot. One drawback. Some of the rooms face Highway 29 which is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay while visiting the Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Villagio was so enjoyable. The property is ideally located within the Napa Valley Wine Country allowing easy access to wineries and restaurants. The hotel itself has beautiful grounds with fountains, flowers and lemon trees. The staff at the hotel was friendly and attentive. A highlight of our stay was the breakfast buffet. The buffet is included in the price of the room and offers something for everyone. What better way to start a day of wine tastings than with a glass of Champagne with breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn last December. Booked 2 nights in a downstairs, inner courtyard, king room. The king bed was very plush and comfortable. The entire room was nicely decorated and I especially liked the granite bathroom countertops. My 6'7" boyfriend used the soaking tub - a bit cramped, but it didn't deter him from a long soak. BIG minus was the noise from upstairs neighbors. It sounded like they were rearranging furniture up there! Footsteps were also very loud. I would not stay in a downstairs room again. I absolutely loved the Mediterranean style grounds and strolled through a couple of times even though it was pouring rain outside. The breakfast buffet was very good and definitely several notches above some of the other places I've stayed. Ordered room service one night- it arrived promptly and was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for special occasions”
Reviews.Author: barbique00
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Villagio. The rooms were fantastic and the service was excellent. We were especially impressed with the gourmet breakfast in the morning that included a lot of imported cheeses and fresh fruits in addition to the standard egg and bacon fare. The landscaping and grounds were gorgeous. We received a gift certificate for our anniversary----I met a couple of other couples there who also were staying on a gift certificates....with good reason...its just a little bit overpriced--even for the Napa/Yountville area. I would stay there for special occasions only.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two-night stay in an "inner courtyard" room with a King and balcony and paid about $300 a night. Here's a quick summary of the Villagio: Positives: Best concierge this side of the Four Seasons Room size was large Location--proximity to the French Laundry, Bouchon Bakery, etc. Nice Pool Negatives: EXTREMELY loud noise constantly from the highway (we had to run the a/c or heating the entire time we were there to provide white noise) Breakfast was not very good (we ate there once and then immediately went to Bouchon Bakery to pay for much better food) Check-in staff needs more training "Soaking tubs" in room are long, but not very deep Balcony was unusable given incredibly loud road noise Water pressure was inadequate Did I mention how loud the highway noise was?? Conclusion: We felt that the hotel clearly tried to be an intimate high-end Napa Valley hotel destination (i.e. spa, nice pool), however, for this price point they failed and I would highly recommend that you consider alternatives (i.e. Gage House Inn, Sonoma Mission Inn, Auberge) if you are approaching the $300 range. If you can stay at the Villagio for under $200, then consider staying here (but only if you are on the "east" side of the property's fountain).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anamacbrat
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed on an overnight midweek (thursday) package that included 2 spa treatments for $372.00 a night. The room was upgraded before arrival so we were not on the freeway side, although it was not an upstairs room. Terrific room, fireplace, wine and glasses and lots of room! We hung out at the hotel bar for a while then had coffee, tea and cookies around 3pm. Our massage appointments were for 5:30pm so we went down to the spa and enjoyed the steam and sauna. Came back to our room and the lights were turned down, the music on and chocolates on the bed. In the morning we went back down to the spa again and then went to the breakfast in the lobby. The breakfast is terrific and the champagne and orange juice were divine! The service is impeccible and the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Really recommend going mid-week as the hotel is not so busy, we had the spa all to ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Napa Wine Tasting Adventures”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villagio with my boyfriend last October (sorry for the late review!). We got a special weekend rate...we loved it! What stands out in my mind was the great location, really central to everything, high quality bed linens and Aveda products, and the yummy breakfast buffet. The weekend we where there was pretty slow--we didn't experience any kind of noise at all, from the highway or from other occupants. Also, had a stone massage and a body wrap at the spa--soooo relaxing. We would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: mrskoz
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel.....Stay Here!!!! We stayed here sadly, just one night 8/15/04. We had a beautiful room with a fireplace and the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. Our balcony overlooked a stream that runs through th property. The afternoon tea was lovely with cookies and tea as well as water and ice tea available outside by the pool. Breakfast was wonderful with a large variety of fruit, cheeses, smoked salmon, eggs muffins, danish ect. The pool area is great with a hot tub and cabanas to snuggle in. The pool was open 24 hrs for adults (as long as you're quite). The concierge was very helpful making reservation for us for dinner at Coles Chop House where we had the best steak we ever ate. Everyone was friendly and bent over backwards to meet our needs. We mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary and when we arrived at our room after dinner not only did we have our bed turned down with chocolates on our pillows, soft music playing and the lights down low, there was a bottle of champagne chilling. I had a very nice massage at the Spa. The Spa has it's own small pool area and you could spend the entire day just relaxing there. The gardens were beautiful. Check out their website for special rates...we got a very good deal with their romance package. I know why this hotel was named one of the top 500 in the US!
